results.name: Pituitary Gland Adenoma
match: ADENOMA, ANTERIOR LOBE PITUITARY GLAND, BENIGN
search: ADENOMA, ANTERIOR LOBE PITUITARY GLAND, BENIGN
results.definition: A non-metastasizing tumor that arises from the adenohypophysial cells of the anterior lobe of the pituitary gland. The tumor can be hormonally functioning or not. The diagnosis can be based on imaging studies and/or radioimmunoassays. Due to its location in the sella turcica, expansion of the tumor mass can impinge on the optic chiasm or involve the temporal lobe, third ventricle and posterior fossa A frequently associated physical finding is bitemporal hemianopsia which may progress to further visual loss.
results.glossary_definition: A benign neoplasm of the anterior lobe of the pituitary gland.
synonyms: ADENOMA, ANTERIOR LOBE PITUITARY GLAND, BENIGN

results.name: Scoliosis
results.definition: A congenital or acquired spinal deformity characterized by lateral curvature of the spine.
results.glossary_definition: A disorder characterized by a malformed, lateral curvature of the spine.

results.name: Muckle-Wells Syndrome
results.definition: An autoinflammatory disease caused by mutations in the NLRP3 gene which encodes cryopyrin. It is characterized by recurrent episodes of urticaria and fever which develop in infancy. It may lead to sensorineural hearing loss and/or amyloidosis.
results.glossary_definition: An autoinflammatory disease caused by mutations in the NLRP3 gene which encodes cryopyrin. It is characterized by recurrent episodes of urticaria and fever which develop in infancy. It may lead to sensorineural hearing loss and/or amyloidosis.

results.name: Amenorrhea
results.definition: The absence of menses in a woman who has achieved reproductive age.
results.glossary_definition: The absence of menses in a woman who has achieved reproductive age.

results.name: Facial Nerve Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the facial nerve (seventh cranial nerve).
results.glossary_definition: A disorder characterized by involvement of the facial nerve (seventh cranial nerve).

results.name: Barth Syndrome
results.definition: A rare X-linked syndrome caused by mutations in TAZ1 gene. Signs and symptoms include cardiomyopathy, neutropenia, muscle weakness and atrophy, growth delay, cardiolipin deficiency and 3-methylglutaconic aciduria.

results.name: Tarsal Tunnel Syndrome
results.definition: A syndrome resulting from the entrapment and compression of the tibial nerve. Signs and symptoms include burning sensation, tingling, and pain in the foot sole.

results.name: Pharyngoconjunctival Fever
results.definition: A condition characterized by fever, conjunctivitis, and pharyngitis resulting from infection by adenovirus.

results.name: Malignant Pyriform Fossa Neoplasm
match: Malignant Neoplasm of the Pyriform Fossa
Malignant Neoplasm of the Pyriform Sinus
Malignant Tumor of the Pyriform Fossa
Malignant Tumor of the Pyriform Sinus
search: Malignant Neoplasm of the Pyriform Fossa
Malignant Neoplasm of the Pyriform Sinus
Malignant Tumor of the Pyriform Fossa
Malignant Tumor of the Pyriform Sinus
results.definition: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm that affects the pyriform sinus.
synonyms: Malignant Neoplasm of the Pyriform Fossa
Malignant Neoplasm of the Pyriform Sinus
Malignant Tumor of the Pyriform Fossa
Malignant Tumor of the Pyriform Sinus

results.name: Thymoma Type AB
results.definition: A thymic epithelial neoplasm characterized by the presence of a lymphocyte-poor component similar to that seen in type A thymoma and a lymphocyte-rich component which contains neoplastic small polygonal epithelial cells. It may be associated with myasthenia gravis and pure red cell aplasia. The majority of cases occur in the anterior mediastinum as Masaoka stage I tumors. A minority of the cases occur as stage II or stage III tumors. The overall survival is reported to be 80-100% at 5 and 10 years.

results.name: Cryptogenic Organizing Pneumonia
results.definition: A form of organizing pneumonia with a non-infectious etiology. Excessive proliferation of granulation tissue occurs in alveolar ducts and alveoli and primarily causes injury to alveolar walls, but bronchioles may be affected.

results.name: Acantholytic Acanthoma
results.definition: A benign epithelial neoplasm of the skin. It presents as a papular or nodular lesion. Morphologically, it is characterized by the presence of hyperkeratosis, acanthosis, papillomatosis, and prominent acantholysis.

results.name: Malignant Mixed Neoplasm
results.definition: A malignant neoplasm composed of a carcinomatous epithelial component and a sarcomatous mesenchymal component. Representative examples include malignant mixed mesodermal (Mullerian) tumor of the female reproductive system and carcinosarcoma of the salivary gland and the lung.
results.glossary_definition: A malignant neoplasm composed of epithelial and/or myoepithelial cells and a mesenchymal component. A general term for which the transformed cell types have not been specified.
children: Mixed Lobular and Ductal Breast Carcinoma
Combined Large Cell Lung Neuroendocrine Carcinoma
Malignant Kidney Mixed Epithelial and Stromal Tumor
Malignant Vaginal Mixed Epithelial and Mesenchymal Neoplasm

results.name: Mucin-Producing Intrahepatic Cholangiocarcinoma
results.definition: An intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma that produces abundant mucin.
ancestors: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Carcinoma
Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Epithelial Neoplasm
Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Neoplasm

results.name: Epididymal Adenocarcinoma
results.definition: A rare adenocarcinoma that arises from the epididymis. It usually presents as a scrotal mass and may be associated with testicular pain.

results.name: Congenital Hypothyroidism
results.definition: A deficiency of thyroid hormone present at birth. The etiology can be genetic or environmental, or a combination of both; treatment is based on severity and causality.
results.glossary_definition: A condition due to congenital lack of thyroid hormone, marked by arrested physical and mental development, dystrophy of the bones and soft parts, and lowered basal metabolism. It is the congenital form of thyroid deficiency, while MYXEDEMA is the acquired form. (From Dorland, 27th ed)

results.name: Hypoglossal Nerve Neoplasm
match: Neoplasm of the Twelfth Cranial Nerve
Tumor of the Twelfth Cranial Nerve
search: Neoplasm of the Twelfth Cranial Nerve
Tumor of the Twelfth Cranial Nerve
synonyms: Neoplasm of the Twelfth Cranial Nerve
Tumor of the Twelfth Cranial Nerve
children: Schwannoma of the Twelfth Cranial Nerve

results.name: Malignant Triton Tumor
match: Malignant Neoplasm of Peripheral Nerve Sheath with Rhabdomyosarcoma
Malignant Neoplasm of the Peripheral Nerve Sheath with Rhabdomyosarcoma
Malignant Peripheral Nerve Sheath Neoplasm with Rhabdomyosarcoma
Malignant Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor with Rhabdomyosarcoma
Malignant Tumor of Peripheral Nerve Sheath with Rhabdomyosarcoma
Malignant Tumor of the Peripheral Nerve Sheath with Rhabdomyosarcoma
search: Malignant Neoplasm of Peripheral Nerve Sheath with Rhabdomyosarcoma
Malignant Neoplasm of the Peripheral Nerve Sheath with Rhabdomyosarcoma
Malignant Peripheral Nerve Sheath Neoplasm with Rhabdomyosarcoma
Malignant Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor with Rhabdomyosarcoma
Malignant Tumor of Peripheral Nerve Sheath with Rhabdomyosarcoma
Malignant Tumor of the Peripheral Nerve Sheath with Rhabdomyosarcoma
results.definition: A malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumor which shows rhabdomyosarcomatous differentiation. More than half of the patients have neurofibromatosis type 1. The prognosis is usually poor.
synonyms: Malignant Neoplasm of Peripheral Nerve Sheath with Rhabdomyosarcoma
Malignant Neoplasm of the Peripheral Nerve Sheath with Rhabdomyosarcoma
Malignant Peripheral Nerve Sheath Neoplasm with Rhabdomyosarcoma
Malignant Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor with Rhabdomyosarcoma
Malignant Tumor of Peripheral Nerve Sheath with Rhabdomyosarcoma
Malignant Tumor of the Peripheral Nerve Sheath with Rhabdomyosarcoma

results.name: Ampulla of Vater Signet Ring Cell Carcinoma
results.name_text: Ampulla of Vater Signet Ring Cell Carcinoma
match: Ampulla of Vater Signet Ring Cell Carcinoma
Ampulla of Vater Signet Ring Cell Carcinoma
search: Ampulla of Vater Signet Ring Cell Carcinoma
Ampulla of Vater Signet Ring Cell Carcinoma
results.definition: An adenocarcinoma arising from the ampulla of Vater. Morphologically, it is characterized by the presence of mucin-containing signet-ring cells.
synonyms: Ampulla of Vater Signet Ring Cell Carcinoma

results.name: Pseudohypoparathyroidism
results.definition: A condition characterized by the insensitivity of the tissues to respond to the activity of the parathyroid hormone. It results in increased levels of parathyroid hormone in the serum, hypocalcemia, and hyperphosphatemia.

results.name: Subglottic Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the subglottic area of the larynx.

results.name: Thymoma Type B3
results.definition: Also known as well-differentiated thymic carcinoma, atypical thymoma, or epithelial thymoma, this type of thymoma displays morphologic characteristics of a well-differentiated carcinoma. The majority of cases occur in the anterior mediastinum as Masaoka stage II or stage III tumors. It is almost always invasive, it recurs frequently, and metastasizes in approximately 20% of the cases.

results.name: Hemorrhoid
results.definition: Dilated veins in the anal canal.
results.glossary_definition: An enlarged or swollen blood vessel, usually located near the anus or the rectum.

results.name: Thymoma Type B2
results.definition: A thymic epithelial neoplasm characterized by the presence of neoplastic large, polygonal epithelial cells with large vesicular nuclei and prominent nucleoli. The neoplastic cells are arranged around perivascular spaces and along septa. Immature T-lymphocytes are also present. It may be associated with myasthenia gravis, pure red cell aplasia, and hypogammaglobulinemia. It is a tumor of moderate malignancy. The majority of cases occur in the anterior mediastinum as Masaoka stage I, stage II, or stage III tumors. Metastatic, stage IV tumors occur less frequently.

results.name: Hemangiopericytoma
results.definition: An antiquated term that refers to benign or malignant mesenchymal neoplasms characterized by the presence of neoplastic spindle-shaped to round cells arranged around thin-walled branching vascular spaces.
results.glossary_definition: A type of cancer involving blood vessels and soft tissue.

results.name: Thymoma Type B1
results.definition: A thymic epithelial neoplasm characterized by the presence of expanded areas which resemble the normal thymic cortex. The neoplastic epithelial cells are small and scant and there is a dense T-lymphocytic component present. Areas of medullary differentiation with or without Hassall's corpuscles are also present. It may be associated with myasthenia gravis, pure red cell aplasia, and hypogammaglobulinemia. It has a low grade malignant potential. The majority of cases occur in the anterior mediastinum as Masaoka stage I tumors. A minority of the cases occur as stage II tumors.

results.name: Atopic Conjunctivitis
results.definition: Acute allergic conjunctivitis.
results.glossary_definition: Conjunctivitis due to hypersensitivity to various allergens.

results.name: Gallbladder Leiomyoma
results.definition: A benign smooth muscle neoplasm arising from the gallbladder. It is characterized by the presence of spindle cells with cigar-shaped nuclei, interlacing fascicles, and a whorled pattern.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Ancylostomiasis
results.definition: Infection by hookworms of the genus Ancylostoma.

results.name: Abducens Nerve Neoplasm
match: Neoplasm of the Sixth Cranial Nerve
Tumor of the Sixth Cranial Nerve
search: Neoplasm of the Sixth Cranial Nerve
Tumor of the Sixth Cranial Nerve
synonyms: Neoplasm of the Sixth Cranial Nerve
Tumor of the Sixth Cranial Nerve

results.name: Jejunal Somatostatin-Producing Neuroendocrine Tumor
match: Delta Cell Tumor of the Jejunum
search: Delta Cell Tumor of the Jejunum
results.definition: A somatostatin-producing neuroendocrine tumor that arises from the jejunum. It is characterized by the presence of tubulo-glandular structures.
synonyms: Delta Cell Tumor of the Jejunum

results.name: Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor of Soft Tissues
results.name_text: Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor of Soft Tissues
match: Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor of Soft Tissues
Peripheral Neuroectodermal Tumor of Soft Tissues
Peripheral Neuroectodermal Tumor of the Soft Tissues
Peripheral Neuroepithelioma of the Soft Tissues
Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor of Soft Tissues
search: Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor of Soft Tissues
Peripheral Neuroectodermal Tumor of Soft Tissues
Peripheral Neuroectodermal Tumor of the Soft Tissues
Peripheral Neuroepithelioma of the Soft Tissues
Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor of Soft Tissues
results.definition: A small round cell tumor with neural differentiation arising from the soft tissues.
synonyms: Peripheral Neuroectodermal Tumor of Soft Tissues
Peripheral Neuroectodermal Tumor of the Soft Tissues
Peripheral Neuroepithelioma of the Soft Tissues
Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor of Soft Tissues
parents: Extraskeletal Ewing Sarcoma/Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor
ancestors: Extraskeletal Ewing Sarcoma/Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor
Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

match: Non Small Cell Lung Cancer NOS
Non-Small Cell Cancer of the Lung
Non-Small Cell Carcinoma of the Lung
search: Non Small Cell Lung Cancer NOS
Non-Small Cell Cancer of the Lung
Non-Small Cell Carcinoma of the Lung
synonyms: Non Small Cell Lung Cancer NOS
Non-Small Cell Cancer of the Lung
Non-Small Cell Carcinoma of the Lung
results.definition: A group of at least three distinct histological types of lung cancer, including non-small cell squamous cell carcinoma, adenocarcinoma, and large cell carcinoma. Non-small cell lung carcinomas have a poor response to conventional chemotherapy.
results.glossary_definition: A group of lung cancers that are named for the kinds of cells found in the cancer and how the cells look under a microscope. The three main types of non-small cell lung cancer are squamous cell carcinoma, large cell carcinoma, and adenocarcinoma. Non-small cell lung cancer is the most common kind of lung cancer.
results.name: Non-Small Cell Lung Carcinoma
Endometrioid Stromal Neoplasm of the Vagina
results.name_text: Endometrioid Stromal Neoplasm of the Vagina
match: Endometrioid Stromal Neoplasm of the Vagina
Endometrioid Stromal Neoplasm of the Vagina
Endometrioid Stromal Tumor of the Vagina
search: Endometrioid Stromal Neoplasm of the Vagina
Endometrioid Stromal Neoplasm of the Vagina
Endometrioid Stromal Tumor of the Vagina
results.definition: A category of rare neoplasms that arise from the vagina. It includes low grade endometrioid stromal sarcoma and undifferentiated sarcoma.
synonyms: Endometrioid Stromal Neoplasm of the Vagina
Endometrioid Stromal Tumor of the Vagina
children: Low Grade Endometrioid Stromal Sarcoma of the Vagina

results.name: Conjunctival Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the conjunctiva. Representative examples include papilloma, squamous cell carcinoma, and melanoma.

results.name: Retinal Artery Occlusion
results.definition: An occlusion of the retinal artery.
results.glossary_definition: Occlusion or closure of the central retinal artery causing sudden, usually nearly complete, loss of vision in one eye. Occlusion of the branch retinal artery causes sudden visual loss in only a portion of the visual field.

results.name: Small Intestinal Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the small intestine. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include lipoma and leiomyoma. Representative examples of malignant neoplasms include carcinoma, lymphoma, and sarcoma.

results.name: Exostosis
results.definition: Non-neoplastic overgrowth of bone.
results.glossary_definition: Benign hypertrophy that projects outward from the surface of bone, often containing a cartilaginous component.

results.name: Breast Invasive Lobular Carcinoma
results.definition: An adenocarcinoma of the breast arising from the lobules. This is a relatively uncommon carcinoma, represents approximately 10% of the breast adenocarcinomas and is often bilateral or multifocal.
results.glossary_definition: Cancer that begins in the lobules (the glands that make milk) of the breast. Lobular carcinoma in situ (LCIS) is a condition in which abnormal cells are found only in the lobules. When cancer has spread from the lobules to surrounding tissues, it is invasive lobular carcinoma. LCIS does not become invasive lobular carcinoma very often, but having LCIS in one breast increases the risk of developing invasive cancer in either breast.

results.name: Gallbladder Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma
match: Oat Cell Carcinoma of the Gallbladder
Small Cell Carcinoma of the Gallbladder
search: Oat Cell Carcinoma of the Gallbladder
Small Cell Carcinoma of the Gallbladder
results.definition: An aggressive, high-grade and poorly differentiated carcinoma with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the gallbladder. It is characterized by the presence of malignant small cells.
synonyms: Oat Cell Carcinoma of the Gallbladder
Small Cell Carcinoma of the Gallbladder

results.name: Granular Corneal Dystrophy
results.definition: A stromal corneal dystrophy that is caused by mutation(s) in the TGFBI gene.

results.name: Syphilis
results.definition: A contagious bacterial infection caused by the spirochete Treponema pallidum. It is a sexually transmitted disorder, although it can also be transmitted from the mother to the fetus in utero. Typically, it is initially manifested with a single sore which heals without treatment. If the infection is left untreated, the initial stage is followed by skin rash and mucous membrane lesions. A late stage follows, which is characterized by damage of the internal organs, including the nervous system.
results.glossary_definition: A contagious venereal disease caused by the spirochete TREPONEMA PALLIDUM.

results.name: Lung Neuroendocrine Neoplasm
results.definition: A low, intermediate, or high grade malignant neoplasm with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the lung. This category includes typical carcinoid tumor, atypical carcinoid tumor, small cell carcinoma, large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma, and combined carcinoma.
children: Combined Large Cell Lung Neuroendocrine Carcinoma

results.name: Acute Contagious Conjunctivitis
results.definition: Acute inflammation of the conjunctiva characterized by pink or red color in the eyes.

results.name: Pulmonary Hypertension
results.definition: Increased pressure within the pulmonary circulation due to lung or heart disorder.
results.glossary_definition: Increased pressure within the pulmonary circulation, usually secondary to cardiac or pulmonary disease.

results.name: Small Intestinal Leiomyoma
results.definition: A benign smooth muscle neoplasm arising from the small intestine. It is characterized by the presence of spindle cells with cigar-shaped nuclei, interlacing fascicles, and a whorled pattern.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Endometrial Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma, Variant with Squamous Differentiation
results.name_text: Endometrial Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma, Variant with Squamous Differentiation
match: Endometrial Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma, Variant with Squamous Differentiation
Endometrial Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma with Squamous Differentiation
Endometrial Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma, Variant with Squamous Differentiation
search: Endometrial Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma, Variant with Squamous Differentiation
Endometrial Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma with Squamous Differentiation
Endometrial Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma, Variant with Squamous Differentiation
results.definition: An endometrioid adenocarcinoma of the endometrium showing squamous differentiation.
synonyms: Endometrial Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma with Squamous Differentiation
Endometrial Endometrioid Adenocarcinoma, Variant with Squamous Differentiation

results.name: Pancreatic Neuroendocrine Neoplasm
results.definition: A neoplasm with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the pancreas. It includes neuroendocrine tumors (low and intermediate grade) and neuroendocrine carcinomas (high grade).

results.name: Birt-Hogg-Dube Syndrome
results.definition: A rare genetic syndrome with an autosomal dominant pattern of inheritance. It is caused by a mutation in the FLCN gene which encodes the protein folliculin. Clinical signs include multiple benign growths of the skin and lungs that begin to manifest in the second or third decade of life. The clinical course is characterized by the progressive growth of new and existing neoplasms. In those with mutations in both copies of FLCN, the kidneys may also be affected by the growth of benign or malignant neoplasms.
results.glossary_definition: An inherited condition in which benign tumors develop in hair follicles on the head, chest, back, and arms. People who have this disorder may be at increased risk of developing colon or kidney cancer.

results.name: Pachyonychia Congenita
results.definition: A rare genetic disorder caused by mutations in the KRT6A, KRT6B, KRT616, and KRT17 genes. It is characterized by hypertrophy and abnormalities in the shape of the fingernails and toe nails.

results.name: Conjunctival Nevus
results.definition: A benign melanocytic neoplasm that arises from the conjunctiva.

results.name: Fibroepithelial Polyp
results.definition: A polypoid lesion composed of fibrous tissue and epithelium. Representative examples include skin tag, anal fibroepithelial polyp, and gingival fibroepithelial polyp.
results.glossary_definition: A benign polypoid tumor comprising fibrous tissue and epithelium.

results.name: Posteroinferior Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
results.name_text: Posteroinferior Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
match: Posteroinferior Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Posteroinferior Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Posteroinferior Myocardial Infarction by EKG Finding
search: Posteroinferior Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Posteroinferior Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Posteroinferior Myocardial Infarction by EKG Finding
results.definition: An electrocardiographic finding of an injury in leads corresponding to the anatomic region of the posteroinferior wall of the heart.
synonyms: Posteroinferior Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Posteroinferior Myocardial Infarction by EKG Finding

results.name: Diffuse Cutaneous Mastocytosis
results.definition: A variant of cutaneous mastocytosis which is seen almost exclusively in children. (WHO, 2001) -- 2003
results.glossary_definition: A form of cutaneous mastocytosis that is characterized by a diffuse erythrodermic rash rather than the maculopapular infiltrates seen in URTICARIA PIGMENTOSA.

results.name: Cutaneous Fibrous Histiocytoma
match: Benign Fibrous Histiocytoma of the Skin
search: Benign Fibrous Histiocytoma of the Skin
results.definition: A solitary, slowly growing, nodular mass, most often affecting the extremities. It is composed of fibrous and histiocytic cells which infiltrate the dermis and occasionally the underlying subcutaneous tissue. Usually local excision is curative. Recurrences are reported only in a small minority of cases.
synonyms: Benign Fibrous Histiocytoma of the Skin
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

children: Splenic Manifestation of Hairy Cell Leukemia
results.definition: A neoplasm of small B-lymphocytes with "hairy" projections in bone marrow, spleen, and peripheral blood. Most patients present with splenomegaly and pancytopenia. (WHO, 2001)
results.glossary_definition: A rare type of leukemia in which abnormal B-lymphocytes (a type of white blood cell) are present in the bone marrow, spleen, and peripheral blood. When viewed under a microscope, these cells appear to be covered with tiny hair-like projections.
results.name: Hairy Cell Leukemia
Tracheitis
results.definition: An inflammatory process affecting the wall of the trachea.
results.glossary_definition: Inflammation of the trachea.

results.name: Multiple System Atrophy
results.definition: A rare neurodegenerative disorder characterized by loss of autonomic nervous system functions and disturbances of motor, balance and muscle coordination.

results.name: Pancreatic Exocrine Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that arises from the epithelial cells of the exocrine pancreatic tissue.

results.name: Bronchogenic Carcinoma
results.definition: A lung carcinoma arising from the bronchial epithelium.
results.glossary_definition: Cancer that begins in the tissue that lines or covers the airways of the lungs, including small cell and non-small cell lung cancer.

results.name: Keratosis
results.definition: Excessive growth of keratin on the skin.
results.glossary_definition: Any horny growth such as a wart or callus.

results.name: Carcinoma
results.definition: A malignant tumor arising from epithelial cells. Carcinomas that arise from glandular epithelium are called adenocarcinomas, those that arise from squamous epithelium are called squamous cell carcinomas, and those that arise from transitional epithelium are called transitional cell carcinomas. Morphologically, the malignant epithelial cells may display abnormal mitotic figures, anaplasia, and necrosis. Carcinomas are graded by the degree of cellular differentiation as well, moderately, or poorly differentiated. Carcinomas invade the surrounding tissues and tend to metastasize to other anatomic sites. Lung carcinoma, skin carcinoma, breast carcinoma, colon carcinoma, and prostate carcinoma are the most frequently seen carcinomas.
results.glossary_definition: Cancer that begins in the skin or in tissues that line or cover internal organs.
children: Metastatic Carcinoma in the Adrenal Medulla

results.name: Extraskeletal Myxoid Chondrosarcoma
results.definition: A rare malignant soft tissue neoplasm of uncertain differentiation, characterized by the presence of chondroblast-like cells in a myxoid stroma and a multinodular growth pattern. The most common sites of involvement are the deep soft tissues of the extremities, particularly the thigh. It usually presents as an enlarging soft tissue mass. Patients may have long survivals, but local recurrences and metastases occur in approximately half of the cases. The most common site of metastasis is the lungs.
ancestors: Malignant Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Nail-Patella Syndrome
results.definition: A rare autosomal dominant syndrome caused by mutations in the LMX1B gene. It is characterized by fingernail deformities, absence or hypoplasia of the patellae, iliac horns, deformities of the radial heads, nephropathy, and glaucoma.

results.name: Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm
results.definition: Enlargement and ballooning of the vessel that supplies arterial blood to the abdomen, pelvis and legs.

results.name: Hepatitis C Infection
results.definition: A viral infection caused by the hepatitis C virus.

results.name: Pulp Degeneration
results.definition: Deterioration of the normal pulp tissue.

results.name: Diabetic Autonomic Neuropathy
results.definition: Autonomic neuropathy that is caused by diabetes mellitus.

results.name: Gallbladder Sarcoma
results.definition: A malignant soft tissue neoplasm that arises from the gallbladder. Representative examples include Kaposi sarcoma, leiomyosarcoma, and rhabdomyosarcoma.

results.name: Bilateral Breast Carcinoma
results.definition: Carcinoma that affects both breasts in a simultaneous or non-simultaneous manner.

results.name: Ophthalmia Neonatorum
results.definition: Inflammation of the conjunctiva in a newborn due to chemical or infectious causes. Aseptic conjunctivitis is often related to the use of prophylactic medications for infectious conjunctivitis. Septic conjunctivitis is related to perinatal exposure to microorganisms.
results.glossary_definition: Inflammation of the conjunctiva in a newborn due to chemical or infectious causes. Aseptic conjunctivitis is often related to the use of prophylactic medications for infectious conjunctivitis. Septic conjunctivitis is related to perinatal exposure to microorganisms.

results.name: Breast Epithelioid Hemangioma
results.definition: A hemangioma characterized by the presence of epithelioid endothelial cells, arising from the breast.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Cowden Syndrome
results.definition: An autosomal dominant hereditary syndrome characterized by a variety of hamartomas and neoplasms including verrucous skin lesions, fibromas of the oral cavity, facial trichilemmomas, hamartomatous colonic polyps, thyroid neoplasms, breast cancer, and dysplastic gangliocytomas of the cerebellum.
results.glossary_definition: An inherited disorder marked by the formation of many noncancerous growths called hamartomas. These growths occur in the skin, breast, thyroid, colon, intestines, and inside of the mouth. Patients with Cowden syndrome are at increased risk of certain types of cancer, including breast and thyroid.

results.name: Mucinous Adenocarcinoma
results.definition: An invasive adenocarcinoma composed of malignant glandular cells which contain intracytoplasmic mucin. Often, the infiltrating glandular structures are associated with mucoid stromal formation. It may arise from the large and small intestine, appendix, stomach, lung, ovary, breast, corpus uteri, cervix, vagina, and salivary gland.
results.glossary_definition: A type of cancer that begins in cells that line certain internal organs and produce mucin (the main component of mucus).

match: Malignant Neoplasm of the Small Bowel
Malignant Neoplasm of the Small Intestine
Malignant Tumor of the Small Bowel
Malignant Tumor of the Small Intestine
search: Malignant Neoplasm of the Small Bowel
Malignant Neoplasm of the Small Intestine
Malignant Tumor of the Small Bowel
Malignant Tumor of the Small Intestine
synonyms: Malignant Neoplasm of the Small Bowel
Malignant Neoplasm of the Small Intestine
Malignant Tumor of the Small Bowel
Malignant Tumor of the Small Intestine
results.definition: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm involving the small intestine.
results.name: Malignant Small Intestinal Neoplasm
Adult Epithelioid Sarcoma
results.definition: An epithelioid sarcoma occurring in adults.

results.name: Duane Syndrome
results.definition: A rare disorder affecting the muscles of the eye. It is characterized by an abnormal contraction of some eye muscles and failure of contraction of other eye muscles. It leads to limited abduction and adduction of the affected eye.

results.name: Glossitis
results.definition: Inflammation of the tongue.
results.glossary_definition: Inflammation of the tongue.

results.name: Thyroid Gland Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the thyroid gland. Representative examples include hyperthyroidism, hypothyroidism, thyroiditis, follicular adenoma, and carcinoma.

results.name: Chondroma
results.definition: A benign well circumscribed neoplasm of hyaline cartilage arising from bone or soft tissue. It is characterized by the presence of chondrocytes.
results.glossary_definition: A benign, well circumscribed neoplasm arising from the hyaline cartilage in soft tissue or bone. It is characterized by the presence of chondrocytes.
children: Chondroma of the Central Nervous System

results.name: Retinal Detachment
results.definition: An eye emergency condition which may lead to blindness if left untreated. It is characterized by the separation of the inner retina layers from the underlying pigment epithelium. Causes include trauma, advanced diabetes mellitus, high myopia, and choroid tumors. Symptoms include sudden appearance of floaters, sudden light flushes, and blurred vision.
results.glossary_definition: Separation of the inner layers of the retina (neural retina) from the pigment epithelium. Retinal detachment occurs more commonly in men than in women, in eyes with degenerative myopia, in aging and in aphakia. It may occur after an uncomplicated cataract extraction, but it is seen more often if vitreous humor has been lost during surgery. (Dorland, 27th ed; Newell, Ophthalmology: Principles and Concepts, 7th ed, p310-12).

results.name: Endemic Goiter
results.definition: Thyroid gland enlargement caused by inadequate dietary iodine intake. It occurs in areas in which the soil lacks iodine compounds or there is low seafood consumption.

results.name: Ainhum
results.definition: Spontaneous autoamputation of a digit, usually the fifth toe. It results from the formation of a fibrotic band which constricts the full radius of the digit and eventually causes the spontaneous autoamputation.

results.name: Sphenoid Sinus Schneiderian Papilloma
match: Schneiderian Papilloma of the Sphenoid Sinus
search: Schneiderian Papilloma of the Sphenoid Sinus
results.definition: A papilloma that arises from the ciliated respiratory mucosa that lines the sphenoid sinus. It is classified as inverted papilloma and oncocytic papilloma.
synonyms: Schneiderian Papilloma of the Sphenoid Sinus

results.name: Macular Degeneration
results.definition: Age-related loss of vision in the central portion of the retina (macula), secondary to retinal degeneration.
results.glossary_definition: A condition in which there is a slow breakdown of cells in the center of the retina (the light-sensitive layers of nerve tissue at the back of the eye). This blocks vision in the center of the eye and can cause problems with activities such as reading and driving. Age-related macular degeneration is most often seen in people who are over the age of 50.

results.name: Tamoxifen-Related Endometrial Disorder
results.definition: A spectrum of endometrial abnormalities that occur in women who use tamoxifen to treat or prevent the development of breast cancer. These abnormalities include endometrial polyps, endometrial hyperplasia, and endometrial carcinoma.

results.name: Leuteoma of Pregnancy
results.definition: A non-neoplastic and self-limited condition that occurs during pregnancy. It is characterized by proliferation of luteinized stromal cells that replace the normal ovarian stromal cells. It is usually manifested with bilateral multinodular ovarian masses. Treatment is not required.

results.name: Van der Woude Syndrome
results.definition: A rare autosomal dominant syndrome caused by mutations in the IRF6 gene. It is characterized by a cleft palate and/or pits on the lower lip. Other signs and symptoms include absent teeth, palate and tongue deformities.

results.name: Colon Neuroendocrine Neoplasm
results.definition: A neoplasm with neuroendocrine differentiation that arises from the colon. It includes well differentiated neuroendocrine tumors (low and intermediate grade) and poorly differentiated neuroendocrine carcinomas (high grade).
children: Colon L-Cell Glucagon-Like Peptide-Producing Neuroendocrine Tumor

results.name: Intestinal Disaccharidase Deficiency and Disaccharide Malabsorption
results.name_text: Intestinal Disaccharidase Deficiency and Disaccharide Malabsorption
match: Intestinal Disaccharidase Deficiency and Disaccharide Malabsorption
Intestinal Disaccharidase Deficiency and Disaccharide Malabsorption
search: Intestinal Disaccharidase Deficiency and Disaccharide Malabsorption
Intestinal Disaccharidase Deficiency and Disaccharide Malabsorption
results.definition: A classification of inherited or acquired disorders of sugar metabolism. Deficiencies of lactase, maltase or sucrase-isomaltase usually occur irreversibly and independent of one another. Congenital deficiencies are rare whereas acquired deficiencies are more common and may be seen following intestinal mucosal brush-border injury. Clinical signs include abdominal cramping, bloating, flatulence and diarrhea following dietary intake of lactose, maltose or sucrose. The clinical course leads to malabsorption of disaccharides which has implications for normal growth and development if manifested at an early age.
synonyms: Intestinal Disaccharidase Deficiency and Disaccharide Malabsorption

results.name: Mixed Cell Adenoma
results.definition: An adenoma characterized by the presence of a mixed epithelial cell population.

results.name: Posterior Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
results.name_text: Posterior Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
match: Posterior Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Posterior Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Posterior Myocardial Infarction by EKG Finding
search: Posterior Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Posterior Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Posterior Myocardial Infarction by EKG Finding
results.definition: An electrocardiographic finding in leads V1 or V2 of an initial R wave duration greater than or equal to 40 ms, R wave greater than S wave, and upright T wave, which is suggestive of myocardial infarction of the posterior wall of the left ventricle. Evidence of inferior or lateral myocardial infarction is usually also present. (CDISC)
results.glossary_definition: An electrocardiographic finding in leads V1 or V2 of an initial R wave duration greater than or equal to 40 ms, R wave greater than S wave, and upright T wave, which is suggestive of myocardial infarction of the posterior wall of the left ventricle. Evidence of inferior or lateral myocardial infarction is usually also present.
synonyms: Posterior Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Posterior Myocardial Infarction by EKG Finding

results.name: Indolent Systemic Mastocytosis
results.definition: An indolent mast cell neoplasm characterized by systemic infiltration of skin and internal organs by aggregates of neoplastic mast cells. There is no evidence of mast cell leukemia or clonal hematologic malignancy. Clinically, there is no evidence of palpable hepatomegaly and splenomegaly, malabsorption syndrome, or pathologic fractures.

results.name: Cervical Endometriosis
results.definition: Endometriosis that affects the cervix. Most patients are asymptomatic. Some patients may present with recurrent minimal uterine bleeding.

results.name: Invasive Malignant Thymoma
results.definition: A malignant thymoma that extends beyond the capsule and infiltrates the surrounding tissues.

results.name: Malignant Glomus Tumor
results.definition: A very rare morphologic variant of glomus tumor with a size greater than 2 cm. The tumor arises in subfascial or visceral tissues. It is characterized by the presence of atypical mitotic figures, or marked nuclear atypia, or the combination of both. It has an aggressive clinical course.

results.name: Verrucous Carcinoma
results.definition: A well differentiated squamous cell carcinoma characterized by a papillary growth pattern, acanthosis, mild cytologic atypia, and pushing tumor margins. The most commonly affected anatomic sites are the oral cavity, nasal cavity, larynx, esophagus, anus, vagina, vulva, and the plantar region of the foot.
results.glossary_definition: A variant of well-differentiated epidermoid carcinoma that is most common in the oral cavity, but also occurs in the larynx, nasal cavity, esophagus, penis, anorectal region, vulva, vagina, uterine cervix, and skin, especially on the sole of the foot. Most intraoral cases occur in elderly male abusers of smokeless tobacco. The treatment is surgical resection. Radiotherapy is not indicated, as up to 30% treated with radiation become highly aggressive within six months. (Segen, Dictionary of Modern Medicine, 1992)

results.name: Thyroid Gland Hyalinizing Trabecular Tumor
match: Hyalinizing Trabecular Adenoma of the Thyroid
Hyalinizing Trabecular Adenoma of the Thyroid
search: Hyalinizing Trabecular Adenoma of the Thyroid
Hyalinizing Trabecular Adenoma of the Thyroid
results.oncotree_disease: Hyalinizing Trabecular Adenoma of the Thyroid
results.definition: A rare, circumscribed or encapsulated tumor arising from the follicular cells of the thyroid gland. It is characterized by a trabecular growth pattern and hyalinized stroma formation. The vast majority of cases have a benign clinical course.
synonyms: Hyalinizing Trabecular Adenoma of the Thyroid

results.name: Bladder Squamous Papilloma
results.definition: A rare, benign neoplasm of bladder that is composed of papillary cores with overlying histologically benign squamous epithelium.

results.name: Deep Benign Fibrous Histiocytoma
results.definition: A rare, well-circumscribed, pseudo-encapsulated benign fibrous histiocytoma that arises entirely within the subcutaneous tissue or deep soft tissue. It usually affects the extremities or the head and neck region. It recurs locally in a minority of cases.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Migraine With Aura
results.definition: A migraine disorder characterized by episodes that are preceded by focal neurological symptoms.
results.glossary_definition: A migraine disorder characterized by episodes that are preceded by focal neurological symptoms.

results.name: Hereditary Elliptocytosis
results.definition: An inherited blood disorder in which a large number of red blood cells have an elliptical morphology.

results.name: Cervical Mullerian Papilloma
results.definition: A rare, benign, papillary neoplasm that arises from the cervix. It is characterized by the presence of a fibrovascular core covered by mucinous epithelial cells.

results.name: Familial Polycythemia
results.definition: Polycythemia that occurs in groups of related individuals.

results.name: Nephrolithiasis
results.definition: The presence of a calculus in the pelvis of the kidney; this is most often composed of mineral salts and proteins.
results.glossary_definition: A crystalline mass in the pelvis of the kidney that is composed of mineral salts and proteins.

results.name: Progressive Multifocal Leukoencephalopathy
results.definition: A progressive demyelination within the central nervous system associated with reactivation of a latent JC virus infection.
results.glossary_definition: A demyelinating central nervous system disease caused by reactivation of the polyomavirus JC, which results in a lytic infection of oligodendrocytes.

results.name: Anal Squamous Cell Carcinoma
match: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Anus
search: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Anus
results.definition: A squamous cell carcinoma (SCC) arising from the anal canal or the anal margin (perianal skin). Human papillomavirus is detected in the majority of cases. Homosexual HIV-positive men have an increased risk of developing anal squamous cell carcinoma in comparison to the general male population. Symptoms include anal pruritus, discomfort when sitting, pain, change in bowel habit, and bleeding. The prognosis is generally better for anal margin SCC than for anal canal SCC.
synonyms: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Anus

results.name: Hereditary Factor XI Deficiency Disease
results.definition: A rare inherited bleeding disorder caused by deficiency of coagulation factor XI. It may be asymptomatic or manifest with bleeding.

results.name: Distal Muscular Dystrophy
results.definition: A group of genetic degenerative muscle disorders affecting the muscles of the lower arms, hands, lower legs, and feet.

results.name: Villous Adenoma
results.definition: An epithelial neoplasm morphologically characterized by the presence of a villous architectural pattern. Most often it occurs in the large intestine, small intestine, and the stomach in which the neoplastic epithelial cells show dysplastic features. It may also arise in the urinary bladder, urethra, and vagina.
results.glossary_definition: A neoplasm that grows in the colon and other places in the gastrointestinal tract and sometimes in other parts of the body. These adenomas may become malignant (cancerous).

results.name: Hidrocystoma
results.definition: A benign cystic proliferation of the sweat glands with apocrine or eccrine differentiation. It usually presents as a dome-shaped, cystic papular or nodular lesion usually in the face and neck. It is a unilocular or mutlilocular lesion lined by an inner and an outer layer of epithelium. Complete excision is usually curative.

results.name: Hereditary Glomangioma
results.definition: A familial glomus tumor.

results.name: Diverticulitis
results.definition: An infection that develops in the diverticula of the intestinal tract. Signs and symptoms include abdominal pain, fever, and leukocytosis.
results.glossary_definition: Inflammation of one or more pouches or sacs that bulge out from the wall of a hollow organ, such as the colon. Symptoms include muscle spasms and cramps in the abdomen.

results.name: Bartholin Gland Adenocarcinoma
results.definition: An adenocarcinoma that arises from the Bartholin gland. Subtypes include papillary and mucinous adenocarcinoma.

results.name: Cardiac Arrest
results.definition: The sudden cessation of cardiac activity in an individual who becomes unresponsive, without normal breathing and no signs of circulation. Cardiac arrest may be reversed by CPR, and/or defibrillation, cardioversion or cardiac pacing.
results.glossary_definition: Sudden cessation of the pumping function of the heart, with disappearance of arterial blood pressure, connoting either ventricular fibrillation or ventricular standstill.

results.name: Squamous Cell Breast Carcinoma, Large Cell Keratinizing Variant
results.name_text: Squamous Cell Breast Carcinoma, Large Cell Keratinizing Variant
match: Squamous Cell Breast Carcinoma, Large Cell Keratinizing Variant
Squamous Cell Breast Carcinoma, Large Cell Keratinizing Variant
search: Squamous Cell Breast Carcinoma, Large Cell Keratinizing Variant
Squamous Cell Breast Carcinoma, Large Cell Keratinizing Variant
results.definition: A squamous cell carcinoma that arises from the breast parenchyma and is characterized by the presence of large malignant cells that exhibit keratinization.
synonyms: Squamous Cell Breast Carcinoma, Large Cell Keratinizing Variant

results.name: Colitis
results.definition: Inflammation of the colon.
results.glossary_definition: Inflammation of the colon.

results.name: Petroclival Meningioma
results.definition: A meningioma that affects the petroclival region.

results.name: Atrioventricular Septal Defect
results.definition: A congenital heart malformation characterized by abnormalities in the anatomic structures that relate to the endocardial cushions. These abnormalities can include defects in the lower part of the atrial septum and the ventricular septum and lack of separation of the mitral and tricuspid valves.

results.name: Polycystic Kidney Disease
results.definition: A usually autosomal dominant and less frequently autosomal recessive genetic disorder characterized by the presence of numerous cysts in the kidneys leading to end-stage renal failure. The autosomal dominant trait is associated with abnormalities on the short arm of chromosome 16. Symptoms in patients with the autosomal dominant trait usually appear at middle age and include abdominal pain, hematuria, and high blood pressure. Patients may develop brain aneurysms and liver cysts. Patients with the autosomal recessive trait present with progressive renal failure early in life and symptoms resulting from hepatic fibrosis. The autosomal recessive trait is associated with abnormalities of chromosome 6. Polycystic kidney disease may also result as a side effect in patients on renal dialysis.

results.name: Ethmoid Sinus Adenoid Cystic Carcinoma
match: Adenoid Cystic Carcinoma of Ethmoid Sinus
Adenoid Cystic Carcinoma of the Ethmoid Sinus
search: Adenoid Cystic Carcinoma of Ethmoid Sinus
Adenoid Cystic Carcinoma of the Ethmoid Sinus
results.definition: An adenoid cystic carcinoma that affects the ethmoid sinus.
synonyms: Adenoid Cystic Carcinoma of Ethmoid Sinus
Adenoid Cystic Carcinoma of the Ethmoid Sinus
ancestors: Paranasal Sinus and Nasal Cavity Cancer

results.name: Cutaneous Leiomyoma
results.definition: A benign smooth muscle neoplasm arising from the arrector pili muscle, tunica media of blood vessels, and dartos muscle of the genitalia. It is characterized by the presence of spindle cells with cigar-shaped nuclei, interlacing fascicles, and a whorled pattern.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Gallbladder Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm affecting the gallbladder. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include lipoma, leiomyoma, and neurofibroma. Representative examples of malignant neoplasms include carcinoma, lymphoma, and sarcoma.
results.glossary_definition: Tumors or cancer of the gallbladder.

results.name: Vitreous Detachment
results.definition: Detachment of the vitreous humor from the retina.

results.name: Bartholin Gland Adenoid Cystic Carcinoma
results.definition: A carcinoma that arises from the Bartholin gland and is characterized by the presence of islands of uniform malignant cells forming cribriform patterns.

results.name: Gastric Ulcer
results.definition: An ulcerated lesion in the mucosal surface of the stomach. It may progress to involve the deeper layers of the gastric wall.
results.glossary_definition: Ulceration of the mucous membrane of the stomach. (From Dorland, 28th ed)

results.name: Gastric Squamous Cell Carcinoma
match: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Stomach
search: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Stomach
results.definition: A rare carcinoma of the stomach resembling squamous cell carcinomas arising elsewhere in the body.
synonyms: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Stomach

results.name: Leishmaniasis
results.definition: A parasitic infection caused by protozoa of the genus Leishmania. It is transmitted to humans via the bite of sandflies. There are three main forms of the disease: cutaneous, mucocutaneous, and visceral leishmaniasis. Cutaneous leishmaniasis causes skin ulcers; mucocutaneous leishmaniasis causes destructive lesions of the mucous membranes of the nose, mouth, and throat; visceral leishmaniasis is the most severe form of the disease and is manifested with anemia, weight loss, hepatomegaly and splenomegaly.
results.glossary_definition: A disease caused by any of a number of species of protozoa in the genus LEISHMANIA. There are four major clinical types of this infection: cutaneous (Old and New World) (LEISHMANIASIS, CUTANEOUS), diffuse cutaneous (LEISHMANIASIS, DIFFUSE CUTANEOUS), mucocutaneous (LEISHMANIASIS, MUCOCUTANEOUS), and visceral (LEISHMANIASIS, VISCERAL).

results.name: Retinal Dystrophy
results.definition: Chronic and progressive degeneration of the retina of the eye.

results.name: Primary Open Angle Glaucoma
results.definition: A form of glaucoma in which there is no visible abnormality in the trabecular meshwork.

results.name: Beta-Ketothiolase Deficiency
results.definition: A rare autosomal recessive inherited disorder caused by mutations in the ACAT1 gene. It is characterized by the reduction or elimination of the enzyme mitochondrial acetoacetyl-CoA thiolase which is responsible for the metabolism of the amino acid isoleucine and ketone-body metabolism. Signs and symptoms appear early in life and include vomiting, dehydration, breathing difficulties, seizures, lethargy, and coma.

results.name: Somatoform Disorder
results.definition: A category of psychiatric disorders which are characterized by the presence of physical symptoms that suggest a medical condition but are not fully explained by any known medical reasons.

results.name: Appendix Lymphoma
results.definition: A lymphoma arising from the appendix. The majority of lymphomas affecting the appendix represent disease extension from the intestinal wall; primary lymphomas of the appendix are rare.

results.name: Pericanalicular Fibroadenoma
results.definition: A morphologic variant of breast fibroadenoma without clinical significance. It is characterized by circumferential proliferation of stromal cells around the ducts. This results in the formation of rounded ductal-epithelial structures.

results.name: Dental Fluorosis
results.definition: A condition that results from excessive fluoride ingestion during tooth development, resulting in tooth discoloration ranging from white streaks to brown stains and cracks or pits in the tooth enamel.
results.glossary_definition: A condition resulting from excessive fluoride ingestion during tooth development resulting in tooth discoloration ranging from white streaks to brown stains, and possible cracks or pits in the enamel.

results.name: Testicular Yolk Sac Tumor
match: Endodermal Sinus Neoplasm of the Testis
Endodermal Sinus Tumor of the Testis
Yolk Sac Neoplasm of the Testis
Yolk Sac Tumor of the Testis
search: Endodermal Sinus Neoplasm of the Testis
Endodermal Sinus Tumor of the Testis
Yolk Sac Neoplasm of the Testis
Yolk Sac Tumor of the Testis
results.definition: A non-seminomatous malignant germ cell tumor arising from the testis. It affects infants, young children, and postpubertal males. It is the most frequently seen testicular neoplasm during childhood. The vast majority of patients present with an asymptomatic scrotal mass. The tumor mimics the yolk sac of the embryo and produces alpha-fetoprotein (AFP). It metastasizes to distant anatomic sites. Prognostic factors relate to the clinical stage and the degree of AFP elevation.
synonyms: Endodermal Sinus Neoplasm of the Testis
Endodermal Sinus Tumor of the Testis
Yolk Sac Neoplasm of the Testis
Yolk Sac Tumor of the Testis
parents: Malignant Testicular Non-Seminomatous Germ Cell Tumor
ancestors: Malignant Testicular Non-Seminomatous Germ Cell Tumor

Testicular Yolk Sac Tumor, Microcystic Pattern
Testicular Yolk Sac Tumor, Myxomatous Pattern
Testicular Yolk Sac Tumor, Papillary Pattern
Testicular Yolk Sac Tumor, Polyvesicular Vitelline Pattern
Testicular Yolk Sac Tumor, Solid Pattern

Prolactin Secreting Neoplasm of the Pituitary

Prolactin Secreting Tumor of the Pituitary
results.definition: An adenoma or carcinoma of the anterior lobe of the pituitary gland that produces prolactin.

Prolactin Producing Neoplasm of the Pituitary Gland

Prolactin Secreting Tumor of the Pituitary

results.name: Malignant Clitoral Neoplasm
results.definition: A malignant neoplasm that affects the clitoris.

results.name: Aggressive NK-Cell Leukemia
results.definition: A rare, highly aggressive, Epstein-Barr virus-associated leukemia, also known as aggressive NK-cell leukemia/lymphoma; it may represent the leukemic counterpart of nasal type extranodal NK/T-cell lymphomas. It affects primarily teenagers and young adults. It is characterized by the systemic proliferation of NK cells in the peripheral blood, bone marrow, liver, and spleen.

results.name: Extrahepatic Bile Duct Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma
match: Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma of Extrahepatic Bile Duct
Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma of the Extrahepatic Bile Duct
search: Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma of Extrahepatic Bile Duct
Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma of the Extrahepatic Bile Duct
results.definition: An embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma that arises from the extrahepatic bile ducts.
synonyms: Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma of Extrahepatic Bile Duct
Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma of the Extrahepatic Bile Duct

results.name: Extrahepatic Bile Duct Mucinous Cystic Neoplasm
results.name_text: Extrahepatic Bile Duct Mucinous Cystic Neoplasm
match: Extrahepatic Bile Duct Mucinous Cystic Neoplasm
Cystadenoma of the Extrahepatic Bile Duct
Extrahepatic Bile Duct Mucinous Cystic Neoplasm
search: Extrahepatic Bile Duct Mucinous Cystic Neoplasm
Cystadenoma of the Extrahepatic Bile Duct
Extrahepatic Bile Duct Mucinous Cystic Neoplasm
results.definition: A mucinous cystic neoplasm that arises from the extrahepatic bile ducts.
synonyms: Cystadenoma of the Extrahepatic Bile Duct
Extrahepatic Bile Duct Mucinous Cystic Neoplasm

results.name: Seborrheic Keratosis
results.definition: A common benign skin neoplasm usually affecting older individuals. The lesions usually are multiple and arise in the face, chest, and shoulders. They appear as black or brown, slightly elevated skin lesions.

results.name: Glioblastoma
results.definition: The most malignant astrocytic tumor (WHO grade IV). It is composed of poorly differentiated neoplastic astrocytes and it is characterized by the presence of cellular polymorphism, nuclear atypia, brisk mitotic activity, vascular thrombosis, microvascular proliferation and necrosis. It typically affects adults and is preferentially located in the cerebral hemispheres. It may develop from diffuse astrocytoma WHO grade II or anaplastic astrocytoma (secondary glioblastoma, IDH-mutant), but more frequently, it manifests after a short clinical history de novo, without evidence of a less malignant precursor lesion (primary glioblastoma, IDH- wildtype). (Adapted from WHO)
results.glossary_definition: A fast-growing type of central nervous system tumor that forms from glial (supportive) tissue of the brain and spinal cord and has cells that look very different from normal cells. GBM usually occurs in adults and affects the brain more often than the spinal cord.
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Ovarian Mixed Epithelial Tumor
match: Mixed Epithelial Neoplasm of the Ovary
Mixed Epithelial Tumor of the Ovary
search: Mixed Epithelial Neoplasm of the Ovary
Mixed Epithelial Tumor of the Ovary
results.definition: A benign, borderline, or malignant mixed epithelial tumor of the ovary. It is characterized by the presence of more than one epithelial cell type, most often serous and endocervical-type mucinous.
synonyms: Mixed Epithelial Neoplasm of the Ovary
Mixed Epithelial Tumor of the Ovary

results.name: Keratopathy
results.definition: Any disorder of the cornea.

results.name: Pineal Region Germinoma
results.definition: A germinoma that arises from the pineal gland.
results.glossary_definition: A type of germ cell tumor that is found in the pineal gland in the brain. Symptoms of pineal germinomas include headaches, changes in vision, nausea, and vomiting.
parents: Malignant Pineal Area Germ Cell Neoplasm
ancestors: Malignant Central Nervous System Germ Cell Tumor
Central Nervous System Germ Cell Tumor
Malignant Pineal Area Germ Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Atypical Choroid Plexus Papilloma
results.definition: A choroid plexus papilloma characterized by increased mitotic activity.

results.name: Malignant Cervical Neoplasm
match: Malignant Neoplasm of the Cervix Uteri
Malignant Neoplasm of the Uterine Cervix
Malignant Tumor of the Cervix Uteri
Malignant Tumor of the Uterine Cervix
search: Malignant Neoplasm of the Cervix Uteri
Malignant Neoplasm of the Uterine Cervix
Malignant Tumor of the Cervix Uteri
Malignant Tumor of the Uterine Cervix
results.definition: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm involving the cervix.
synonyms: Malignant Neoplasm of the Cervix Uteri
Malignant Neoplasm of the Uterine Cervix
Malignant Tumor of the Cervix Uteri
Malignant Tumor of the Uterine Cervix
children: Malignant Cervical Mixed Epithelial and Mesenchymal Neoplasm

results.name: Central Retinal Artery Occlusion
results.definition: Blockage of the central retinal artery.
results.glossary_definition: Occlusion of central retinal artery.

results.name: Mediastinal Lymphoma
results.definition: A lymphoma that arises from the mediastinum. Representative examples include mediastinal (thymic) large B-cell lymphoma and Hodgkin lymphoma.

results.name: Rectal Leiomyoma
results.definition: A well-circumscribed benign smooth muscle neoplasm arising from the rectum. It is characterized by the presence of spindle cells with cigar-shaped nuclei, interlacing fascicles, and a whorled pattern.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Narcolepsy
results.definition: A sleep disorder characterized by a tendency for excessive sleepiness during the day which occurs even after adequate sleep in the nighttime. The persons who suffer from this condition experience fatigue and may fall asleep at inappropriate times during the day.

results.name: Childhood Fibrosarcoma
results.definition: A malignant neoplasm arising from the deep soft tissues in children. It is characterized by the presence of spindle-shaped fibroblasts and collagenous stroma formation in a herringbone growth pattern.

results.name: Anal Leiomyoma
results.definition: A well-circumscribed benign smooth muscle neoplasm arising from the anus. It is characterized by the presence of spindle cells with cigar-shaped nuclei, interlacing fascicles, and a whorled pattern.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Hereditary Retinoblastoma
results.definition: An inherited malignant tumor that originates in the nuclear layer of the retina. A predisposition to retinoblastoma has been associated with 13q14 cytogenetic abnormalities. Patients with the inherited form appear to be at increased risk for secondary nonocular malignancies such as osteosarcoma, malignant fibrous histiocytoma, and fibrosarcoma.

results.name: Lipoadenoma
results.definition: An adenoma in which the neoplastic epithelial cells are admixed with adipose tissue cells.
results.glossary_definition: Benign mixed neoplasm comprised of epithelial/glandular and lipomatous structures.

results.name: Malignant Lip Neoplasm
results.definition: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm involving the lip.

results.name: Malignant Postcricoid Neoplasm
match: Malignant Neoplasm of the Postcricoid Area
Malignant Tumor of the Postcricoid Area
search: Malignant Neoplasm of the Postcricoid Area
Malignant Tumor of the Postcricoid Area
results.definition: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm that affects the postcricoid region.
synonyms: Malignant Neoplasm of the Postcricoid Area
Malignant Tumor of the Postcricoid Area

results.name: Open Angle Glaucoma
results.definition: Chronic outflow obstruction of the eye's drainage canals that can lead to increased internal eye pressure and optic nerve damage.
results.glossary_definition: Optic nerve damage secondary to chronic outflow obstruction.

results.name: Ureter Inverted Papilloma
results.definition: A neoplasm of the ureter in which the epithelial cells grow downward into the underlying supportive tissue, which often causes hematuria.

results.name: Premature Menopause
results.definition: Cessation of menstruation before the age of 40. Symptoms include hot flashes, night sweats, mood swings, and decreased sex drive.
results.glossary_definition: A condition in which the ovaries stop working and menstrual periods stop before age 40. Natural menopause usually occurs around age 50. A woman is said to be in menopause when she hasn't had a period for 12 months in a row. Symptoms of menopause include hot flashes, mood swings, night sweats, vaginal dryness, trouble concentrating, and infertility. Premature menopause can be caused by some cancer treatments, surgery to remove the ovaries, and certain diseases or genetic conditions.

results.name: Metachronous Osteosarcoma
results.definition: A bone osteosarcoma that has metastasized to skeletal or extraskeletal sites.
ancestors: Malignant Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Papilledema
results.definition: Swelling around the optic disc, usually due to increased intracranial pressure or pressure on the optic nerve by a tumor.
results.glossary_definition: Swelling around the optic disk, the area where the optic nerve (the nerve that carries messages from the eye to the brain) enters the eyeball. Papilledema occurs when increased brain pressure caused by tumors or other problems results in swelling of the optic nerve.

results.definition: A usually painless malignant tumor that arises from adipose tissue. Microscopically, it may contain a spectrum of neoplastic adipocytes ranging from lipoblasts to pleomorphic malignant adipocytes. Morphologic variants include: well differentiated, dedifferentiated, pleomorphic, and myxoid liposarcoma. The metastatic potential is higher in less differentiated tumors.
results.glossary_definition: A malignant neoplasm composed of adipose tissue.
results.name: Liposarcoma
Alagille Syndrome
results.definition: An autosomal dominant genetic syndrome caused by mutations in the JAG1 gene. It is characterized by cholestatic jaundice in infancy, hepatosplenomegaly, distinctive facial features (prominent forehead, elongated nose, and pointed chin), cardiac murmurs, bone malformations, and sometimes mild mental retardation.

results.name: Short QT Syndrome
match: Ventricular arrhythmia associated with short QT syndrome
search: Ventricular arrhythmia associated with short QT syndrome
results.definition: Ventricular tachyarrhythmias occurring in association with short QT syndrome.
results.glossary_definition: Short QT Syndrome is characterized by a QT interval of less than or equal to 300 ms.
synonyms: Ventricular arrhythmia associated with short QT syndrome

results.name: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Carcinoma

Cancer of the Liver and Intrahepatic Biliary Tract

Liver and Intrahepatic Biliary Tract Carcinoma
results.definition: A carcinoma that arises from the hepatocytes or intrahepatic bile ducts. The main subtypes are hepatocellular carcinoma (hepatoma) and cholangiocarcinoma.
results.glossary_definition: Primary liver cancer is cancer that forms in the tissues of the liver. Secondary liver cancer is cancer that spreads to the liver from another part of the body.
synonyms: Cancer of Liver and Intrahepatic Biliary Tract
Cancer of the Liver and Intrahepatic Biliary Tract
Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancer

results.name: Papilloma
results.definition: A benign epithelial neoplasm that projects above the surrounding epithelial surface and consists of villous or arborescent outgrowths of fibrovascular stroma.
results.glossary_definition: A benign epithelial neoplasm that projects above the surrounding epithelial surface.

results.name: Interstitial Myositis
results.definition: A form of myositis that is characterized by the formation of connective tissue within the muscle.

results.name: Epidermolysis Bullosa Acquisita
results.definition: A chronic autoimmune inflammatory disorder characterized by the formation of subepidermal blisters in the skin and the mucous membranes.
results.glossary_definition: An acquired blistering disease of the skin that has the clinical and pathologic findings similar to the group of inherited disorders called "Epidermolysis Bullosa", which are characterized by recurrent blisters from abnormal or absent essential components of the basement membrane zone or epidermal cell layer.

results.name: Petit Mal Seizure
results.definition: Generalized seizure that manifests in a form of a brief episode of impairment of consciousness with or without accompanying motor phenomena such as clonic-tonic components, automatisms, or autonomic components.
results.glossary_definition: The seizure seen in absence epilepsy, consisting of a sudden momentary break in consciousness of thought or activity, often accompanied by automatisms or clonic movements, especially of the eyelids.

results.name: Kallmann Syndrome
results.definition: An X-linked or autosomal dominant genetic syndrome characterized by hypogonadotropic hypogonadism and anosmia.

results.name: Cartilage Hair Hypoplasia
results.definition: A rare autosomal recessive inherited disorder caused by mutation in the gene for RNAase RMRP. It is characterized by short-limb dwarfism, presence of fine sparse hair, and T-and B-cell immunodeficiency.

results.name: Periapical Dental Abscess
results.definition: Localized collection of pus in the tissues that enclose the root of a tooth.
results.glossary_definition: Acute or chronic inflammation of tissues surrounding the apical portion of a tooth, associated with the collection of pus, resulting from infection following pulp infection through a carious lesion or as a result of an injury causing pulp necrosis. (Dorland, 27th ed)

results.name: Intrahepatic Cholestasis
results.definition: Impairment of the bile flow caused by obstruction within the liver.

results.name: Sicca Syndrome
results.definition: A constellation of symptoms that include abnormal dryness of the mouth, eyes and other mucous membranes. The condition is seen in patients with Sjogren syndrome, sarcoidosis, amyloidosis, and deficiencies of vitamins A and C.
results.glossary_definition: A syndrome of dry eyes and/or dry mouth due to autoimmune destruction of the lacrimal and salivary glands, respectively. It is one of the major manifestations of Sjogren syndrome.

results.name: Malignant Granular Cell Tumor
results.definition: An uncommon granular cell tumor which may metastasize to other anatomic sites. Morphologic characteristics include the presence of spindling neoplastic cells, necrosis, extensive pleomorphism, prominent nucleoli, and increased mitiotic activity.
results.glossary_definition: A malignant neoplasm, comprised of large cells with cytoplasmatic granules, occurring in various organs/tissues.

results.name: Hypersplenism
results.definition: Overactive functioning of the spleen, resulting in excessive destruction of blood cells.
results.glossary_definition: Condition characterized by splenomegaly, some reduction in the number of circulating blood cells in the presence of a normal or hyperactive bone marrow, and the potential for reversal by splenectomy.

results.name: Intraductal Breast Papillomatosis
results.definition: A benign breast neoplasm characterized by the proliferation of multiple papillomas within the lumen of the ducts.

results.name: Mast Cell Sarcoma
results.definition: A rare entity characterized by localized but destructive growth of a tumor consisting of highly atypical, immature mast cells.(WHO, 2001)

results.name: Spondylolysis
results.definition: A defect in the pars interarticularis of a vertebral bone.
results.glossary_definition: Dissolution of a vertebra, especially the pars interarticularis.

results.name: Obstructive Sleep Apnea
results.definition: Cessation of air flow during sleep due to upper airway obstruction.
results.glossary_definition: Cessation of air flow during sleep due to upper airway obstruction.

results.name: Vestibulocochlear Nerve Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the acoustic nerve.
results.glossary_definition: A disorder characterized by involvement of the acoustic nerve (eighth cranial nerve).

results.name: Ethmoid Sinus Adenocarcinoma
results.definition: An adenocarcinoma that arises from the ethmoid sinus. It is classified as intestinal-type or non-intestinal-type adenocarcinoma. Nasal obstruction and epistaxis are the presenting signs.
ancestors: Paranasal Sinus and Nasal Cavity Cancer
Nasal Cavity and Paranasal Sinus Carcinoma

results.name: Spindle Cell Uveal Melanoma
match: Spindle Cell Melanoma of the Uvea
search: Spindle Cell Melanoma of the Uvea
results.definition: A melanoma arising from the choroid, ciliary body, or the iris. It is characterized by the presence of spindle-shaped melanocytes.
synonyms: Spindle Cell Melanoma of the Uvea

results.name: Psychiatric Disorder
results.definition: A disorder characterized by behavioral and/or psychological abnormalities, often accompanied by physical symptoms. The symptoms may cause clinically significant distress or impairment in social and occupational areas of functioning. Representative examples include anxiety disorders, cognitive disorders, mood disorders and schizophrenia.
results.glossary_definition: broad class of abnormalities of thought, feeling, and behavior, resulting in distress or impairment.

results.name: Histrionic Personality Disorder
results.definition: A disorder characterized by an enduring pattern of excessively intense and superficial emotionality, attention seeking behavior, seductive appearance and speech, self dramatization and/or theatrical behavior.

results.name: Brain Germinoma
ancestors: Malignant Central Nervous System Germ Cell Tumor
Central Nervous System Germ Cell Tumor

results.name: Staphylococcal Scalded Skin Syndrome
results.definition: A blistering skin disorder caused by exfoliative toxins produced by Staphylococcus aureus infection. The toxins cause the formation of bullae and diffuse skin desquamation. The lesions may be localized or generalized, far away from the initial site of infection.

results.name: Ureteric Orifice
results.definition: The opening of the ureter in the bladder that is situated at the lateral angle of the trigone.

results.name: Subglottic Carcinoma
results.definition: A carcinoma of the larynx that arises from the subglottic area.

synonyms: Mixed Cell Type Kidney Wilms Tumor

Adenoid Cystic Carcinoma of the Cervix
Adenoid Cystic Carcinoma of the Uterine Cervix
results.definition: A rare carcinoma that arises from the cervix. It is characterized by the presence of cystic spaces surrounded by palisaded epithelial cells. The cystic spaces contain eosinophilic hyaline material or mucin. Nuclear pleomorphism, necrotic changes, and a high mitotic rate are also present.
synonyms: Adenoid Cystic Carcinoma of Cervix Uteri

results.name: Bacterial Gastritis
results.definition: Gastritis resulting from bacteria.

results.name: Clivus Chondroid Chordoma
results.definition: A slow-growing malignant bone tumor arising from the remnants of the notochord and occurring in the clivus. It is characterized by a lobulated growth pattern, myxoid stroma formation, the presence of physaliphorous cells and cartilage.
ancestors: Malignant Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Kidney Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm affecting the kidney. Representative examples of benign renal neoplasms include fibroma, lipoma, oncocytoma, and juxtaglomerular cell tumor. Representative examples of malignant renal neoplasms include renal cell carcinoma, renal pelvis carcinoma, Wilms tumor, rhabdoid tumor, sarcoma, and lymphoma.
children: Mixed Epithelial Stromal Tumor of the Kidney

results.name: Synchronous Bilateral Breast Carcinoma
results.definition: Carcinoma that is detected in one breast within two months from the diagnosis of carcinoma in the other breast.

results.name: Prostate Stromal Sarcoma
results.definition: A rare malignant neoplasm arising from specialized prostatic stroma. It is characterized by the presence of stromal overgrowth and hypercellularity, increased number of mitotic figures, and pleomorphism.

results.name: Chromophobe Renal Cell Carcinoma
match: Chromophobe Cell Carcinoma of the Kidney
search: Chromophobe Cell Carcinoma of the Kidney
results.definition: A type of carcinoma that comprises a minority of renal cell carcinomas. It is characterized by loss of chromosomes 1 and Y. Based on the cytoplasmic characteristics of the neoplastic cells, this type of carcinoma is classified as classic (typical) or eosinophilic. It has a much better prognosis than other renal cell carcinomas.
synonyms: Chromophobe Cell Carcinoma of the Kidney
children: Classic Variant of Chromophobe Renal Cell Carcinoma
Eosinophilic Variant of Chromophobe Renal Cell Carcinoma

results.name: Neurodermatitis
results.definition: Skin findings arising from repeated rubbing, picking or scratching of a real or imagined irritation of the skin.
results.glossary_definition: Skin findings arising from repeated rubbing, picking or scratching of a real or imagined irritation of the skin.

results.name: Burkitt Lymphoma
match: Small Non-Cleaved Cell Lymphoma, Burkitt's Type
search: Small Non-Cleaved Cell Lymphoma, Burkitt's Type
results.definition: A highly aggressive lymphoma composed of monomorphic medium-sized B-cells with basophilic cytoplasm and numerous mitotic figures. It is often associated with the presence of Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) and is commonly seen in AIDS patients. Three morphologic variants are recognized: classical Burkitt lymphoma, Burkitt lymphoma with plasmacytoid differentiation, and atypical Burkitt/Burkitt-like lymphoma. All cases express the MYC translocation [t(8;14)]. (WHO, 2001)
results.glossary_definition: An aggressive (fast-growing) type of B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma that occurs most often in children and young adults. The disease may affect the jaw, central nervous system, bowel, kidneys, ovaries, or other organs. There are three main types of Burkitt lymphoma (sporadic, endemic, and immunodeficiency related). Sporadic Burkitt lymphoma occurs throughout the world, and endemic Burkitt lymphoma occurs in Africa. Immunodeficiency-related Burkitt lymphoma is most often seen in AIDS patients.
synonyms: Small Non-Cleaved Cell Lymphoma, Burkitt's Type

results.name: Benign Secondary Hypertension
results.definition: Mild to moderate high blood pressure that is caused by an underlying medical condition.

results.name: Uterine Corpus Adenofibroma
match: Adenofibroma of the Body of Uterus
search: Adenofibroma of the Body of Uterus
results.definition: A usually polypoid, benign neoplasm that arises from the endometrial cavity. It is characterized by the presence of a mesenchymal core component and an epithelial component that forms a lining on the mesenchymal core.
synonyms: Adenofibroma of the Body of Uterus

results.name: Uremic Neuropathy
results.definition: Neuropathy resulting from uremia.

results.name: Angiolipoma
results.definition: A lipoma with prominent vascularity. The vascular tissue is more abundant at the periphery of the tumor and contains fibrin thrombi. It occurs more frequently in younger individuals as a painful subcutaneous nodule, often on the arms.
results.glossary_definition: A lipoma characterized by prominent vascularization.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Malignant Gastric Germ Cell Tumor
match: Malignant Germ Cell Neoplasm of Stomach
Malignant Germ Cell Neoplasm of the Stomach

search: Malignant Germ Cell Neoplasm of Stomach

Malignant Germ Cell Tumor of Stomach
Malignant Germ Cell Tumor of the Stomach
results.definition: A malignant germ cell tumor that arises from the stomach. It includes choriocarcinoma and immature teratoma.
synonyms: Malignant Germ Cell Neoplasm of Stomach
Malignant Germ Cell Neoplasm of the Stomach
Malignant Germ Cell Tumor of Stomach
Malignant Germ Cell Tumor of the Stomach

results.name: Ampulla of Vater Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma
results.name_text: Ampulla of Vater Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma
match: Ampulla of Vater Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma
Ampulla of Vater Small Cell Carcinoma
Ampulla of Vater Small Cell NEC
Ampulla of Vater Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma
Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Ampullary Region
search: Ampulla of Vater Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma
Ampulla of Vater Small Cell Carcinoma
Ampulla of Vater Small Cell NEC
Ampulla of Vater Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma
Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Ampullary Region
results.definition: An aggressive neuroendocrine carcinoma arising from the ampulla of Vater and the periampullary region. Morphologically, it is characterized by the presence of small malignant cells, necrosis, and a high mitotic rate. Signs and symptoms include jaundice, abdominal pain, anorexia, nausea, vomiting, and weight loss.
