synonyms: Ampulla of Vater Small Cell Carcinoma
Ampulla of Vater Small Cell NEC
Ampulla of Vater Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma
Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Ampullary Region

results.name: Craniofacial Dysostosis
results.definition: A syndrome inherited in an autosomal dominant pattern. It is characterized by early fusion of the bones of the skull and face. Patients have a distinctive facial appearance which includes low-set ears, brachycephaly, hypertelorism, exophthalmos, and mandibular prognathism.

results.name: Jugular Foramen Schwannoma
results.definition: A rare intracranial schwannoma that affects the jugular foramen.
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Childhood Infratentorial Neoplasm
results.definition: A neoplasm that affects the infratentorial region of the brain and occurs during childhood.

results.name: Schizophreniform Disorder
results.definition: A disorder that differs from schizophrenia specifically in total duration (schizophreniform disorder lasts at least 1 month but less than 6 months whereas schizophrenia lasts at least 6 months); schizophreniform disorder also typically causes less impairment in the individual's social and occupational functioning.

results.name: Pallister-Hall Syndrome
results.definition: A very rare autosomal dominant inherited disorder caused by mutations in the GLI3 gene. It is characterized by a spectrum of abnormalities which include polydactyly, cutaneous syndactyly, bifid epiglottis, hypothalamic hamartoma, and laryngotracheal cleft.

results.name: Large Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma
results.definition: A usually aggressive carcinoma composed of large malignant cells which display neuroendocrine characteristics. It is characterized by the presence of high mitotic activity and necrotic changes. The vast majority of cases are positive for neuron-specific enolase. Representative examples include lung, breast, cervical, and thymic neuroendocrine carcinomas.
children: Combined Large Cell Lung Neuroendocrine Carcinoma

results.name: Childhood Osteosarcoma
results.definition: An osteosarcoma occurring in childhood.

results.name: Communication Disorder
results.definition: A disorder characterized by an individual's inability to comprehend or share ideas or feelings because of an impairment in language, speech, or hearing.

results.name: Mansonelliasis
results.definition: A parasitic infection caused by the nematode Mansonella. Signs and symptoms include pruritus, headache, fever, arthralgias, and eosinophilia.

results.name: Pilomatrical Carcinoma
results.definition: A very rare, locally aggressive, malignant neoplasm of the hair follicle. The majority of the cases arise de novo, however malignant transformation from a pre-existing pilomatricoma has been reported. It usually presents as a solitary nodule in the head and neck, upper extremities, or buttocks. Morphologically, it is characterized by the presence of aggregates of basaloid cells infiltrating the dermis. Masses of ghost cells are present in the cellular aggregates. Complete surgical excision is the treatment of choice. If it is not completely removed, it usually recurs, but it rarely metastasizes to distant anatomic sites.

results.name: Follicular Variant Thyroid Gland Papillary Carcinoma
results.name_text: Follicular Variant Thyroid Gland Papillary Carcinoma
match: Follicular Variant Thyroid Gland Papillary Carcinoma
Follicular Variant Papillary Thyroid Gland Carcinoma
Follicular Variant Thyroid Gland Papillary Carcinoma
search: Follicular Variant Thyroid Gland Papillary Carcinoma
Follicular Variant Papillary Thyroid Gland Carcinoma
Follicular Variant Thyroid Gland Papillary Carcinoma
results.definition: A morphologic variant of papillary carcinoma of the thyroid gland characterized by the absence of papillary structures, and the presence of follicular structures.  The malignant follicular cells display the nuclear characteristics that characterize the papillary adenocarcinomas of the thyroid gland.
synonyms: Follicular Variant Papillary Thyroid Gland Carcinoma
Follicular Variant Thyroid Gland Papillary Carcinoma

results.name: Acute Intestinal Ischemia
results.definition: Ischemia of the intestine that is rapid in onset.

results.name: CHARGE Syndrome
match: Coloboma, Heart Malformation, Choanal Atresia, Retardation of Growth and Development, Genital Abnormalities, and Ear Malformations (CHARGE) Association
search: Coloboma, Heart Malformation, Choanal Atresia, Retardation of Growth and Development, Genital Abnormalities, and Ear Malformations (CHARGE) Association
results.definition: A rare autosomal dominant syndrome usually caused by mutations in the CHD7 gene. The term CHARGE is an acronym for the following unusual congenital abnormalities that are associated with this syndrome: coloboma of the eye, heart defects, choanal atresia, growth and developmental retardation, genital, and ear abnormalities.
synonyms: Coloboma, Heart Malformation, Choanal Atresia, Retardation of Growth and Development, Genital Abnormalities, and Ear Malformations (CHARGE) Association

results.name: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Disorder
results.name_text: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Disorder
match: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Disorder
Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Disorder
search: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Disorder
Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the liver parenchyma and intrahepatic bile ducts. Representative examples of non-neoplastic disorders include hepatitis, cirrhosis, cholangitis, and polycystic liver disease. Representative examples of neoplastic disorders include hepatocellular adenoma, hepatocellular carcinoma, intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma, lymphoma, and angiosarcoma.
synonyms: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Disorder

results.name: Micropapillary Serous Carcinoma
results.definition: An adenocarcinoma characterized by the presence of complex micropapillary structures covered by round and cuboidal cells with a high nuclear to cytoplasmic ratio.

results.name: Factor I Deficiency
results.definition: A usually inherited blood coagulation disorder characterized by the partial or complete absence of fibrinogen in the blood, resulting in bleeding.

results.name: Papillary Adenocarcinoma
results.definition: A morphologic variant of adenocarcinoma. It is characterized by the presence of a papillary growth pattern. Representative examples include thyroid gland papillary carcinoma, invasive papillary breast carcinoma, and ovarian serous surface papillary adenocarcinoma.
results.glossary_definition: An adenocarcinoma with papillary growth pattern.

results.name: Microcephaly
results.definition: A congenital or acquired developmental disorder in which the circumference of the head is smaller than normal for the person's age and sex.

results.name: Localized Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor
results.definition: A small round cell tumor with neural differentiation, confined to a specific site without evidence of spread to another anatomic site.
ancestors: Malignant Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Hypopyon
results.definition: An accumulation of pus in the anterior chamber of the eye.
results.glossary_definition: Layering of inflammatory cells in the anterior chamber of the eye.

results.name: Malignant Testicular Germ Cell Tumor
match: Malignant Germ Cell Neoplasm of Testis
Malignant Germ Cell Neoplasm of the Testis
Malignant Germ Cell Tumor of Testis
Malignant Germ Cell Tumor of the Testis
Testicular cancer (excluding germ cell or trophoblastic cancer)
search: Malignant Germ Cell Neoplasm of Testis
Malignant Germ Cell Neoplasm of the Testis
Malignant Germ Cell Tumor of Testis
Malignant Germ Cell Tumor of the Testis
Testicular cancer (excluding germ cell or trophoblastic cancer)
results.definition: A malignant tumor predominantly affecting young men and often associated with cryptorchidism. Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor.
results.glossary_definition: Cancer that forms in tissues of the testis (one of two egg-shaped glands inside the scrotum that make sperm and male hormones). Testicular cancer usually occurs in young or middle-aged men. Two main types of testicular cancer are seminomas (cancers that grow slowly and are sensitive to radiation therapy) and nonseminomas (different cell types that grow more quickly than seminomas).
synonyms: Malignant Germ Cell Neoplasm of Testis
Malignant Germ Cell Neoplasm of the Testis
Malignant Germ Cell Tumor of Testis
Malignant Germ Cell Tumor of the Testis
Testicular cancer (excluding germ cell or trophoblastic cancer)
children: Childhood Testicular Mixed Germ Cell Neoplasm
Malignant Testicular Non-Seminomatous Germ Cell Tumor
Refractory Malignant Testicular Germ Cell Tumor

results.name: Pancoast Syndrome
results.definition: A rare neoplastic syndrome characterized by obstruction of the thoracic outlet leading to compression of the brachial plexus and vessels within. It is usually caused by a malignant neoplasm in the superior pulmonary sulcus. The most commonly involved neoplasms are non-small cell lung carcinomas. Clinical signs include Horner's syndrome, shoulder pain radiating down the arm in the ulnar distribution followed by edema and atrophy of the affected extremity. Clinical course usually leads to early local invasion of the bony thoracic structures. Prognosis is highly stage-dependent.

results.name: Multi-Infarct Dementia
results.definition: A common form of dementia caused by multiple cortical or subcortical cerebral infarctions.
results.glossary_definition: dementia, due to significant cerebrovascular disease, with a stepwise deteriorating course and a 'patchy' distribution of neurologic deficits.

results.name: Mediastinal Extraskeletal Osteosarcoma
results.definition: An osteosarcoma arising from the mediastinum.

results.name: Mobius Syndrome
results.definition: A very rare congenital syndrome affecting the sixth and seventh cranial nerves. It is characterized by facial paralysis leading to lack of facial expression and the inability to move the eyes laterally.

results.name: Nasal Cavity and Paranasal Sinus Lethal Midline Granuloma
results.name_text: Nasal Cavity and Paranasal Sinus Lethal Midline Granuloma
match: Nasal Cavity and Paranasal Sinus Lethal Midline Granuloma
Midline Lethal Granuloma of Nasal Cavity and Paranasal Sinus
Midline Lethal Granuloma of the Nasal Cavity and Paranasal Sinus
Nasal Cavity and Paranasal Sinus Lethal Midline Granuloma
search: Nasal Cavity and Paranasal Sinus Lethal Midline Granuloma
Midline Lethal Granuloma of Nasal Cavity and Paranasal Sinus
Midline Lethal Granuloma of the Nasal Cavity and Paranasal Sinus
Nasal Cavity and Paranasal Sinus Lethal Midline Granuloma
results.definition: An aggressive, progressive, and destructive lesion affecting the nasal cavities, paranasal sinuses, and the palate. The vast majority of cases are malignant lymphoproliferations affecting the midline of the face in patients with nasal type extranodal NK/T-cell lymphoma.
synonyms: Midline Lethal Granuloma of Nasal Cavity and Paranasal Sinus
Midline Lethal Granuloma of the Nasal Cavity and Paranasal Sinus
Nasal Cavity and Paranasal Sinus Lethal Midline Granuloma

results.name: Adult Spinal Cord Ependymoma
results.definition: An ependymoma of the spinal cord occurring in adults.
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Multicentric Reticulohistiocytosis
results.definition: A systemic disease, often associated with arthritis, fever, and weight loss. The cutaneous lesions consist of histiocytes, which are usually confined to the dermis. A large number of patients develop malignant tumors (carcinomas, sarcomas, and lymphomas). --2003

results.name: Inflammatory Bowel Disease
results.definition: A spectrum of small and large bowel inflammatory diseases of unknown etiology. It includes Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis, and colitis of indeterminate type.
results.glossary_definition: A general term that refers to the inflammation of the colon and rectum. Inflammatory bowel disease includes ulcerative colitis and Crohn's disease.

results.name: Peripheral Nerve Schwannoma
results.definition: A benign, usually encapsulated slow growing tumor of the peripheral nervous system composed of Schwann cells. It recurs infrequently and only rare cases associated with malignant transformation have been reported.
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Granulocytopenia
results.definition: A decrease in the number of mature granulocytes (neutrophils, eosinophils, and basophils) in the peripheral blood.
results.glossary_definition: A condition in which there is a lower-than-normal number of granulocytes (a type of white blood cell).

results.name: Juvenile Myoclonic Epilepsy
results.definition: An epilepsy characterized by myoclonic jerks, generalized tonic-clonic seizures, and sometimes absence seizures. It appears during adolescence.

results.name: Agoraphobia
results.definition: An anxiety disorder characterized by an intense, irrational fear of venturing out into open places or situations in which help (or escape) might not be available should excessive anxiety or panic symptoms develop.

results.name: Squamous Cell Lung Carcinoma
match: Epidermoid Cell Carcinoma of the Lung
Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Lung
search: Epidermoid Cell Carcinoma of the Lung
Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Lung
results.definition: A carcinoma arising from malignant squamous bronchial epithelial cells and characterized by the presence of keratinization and/or intercellular bridges. Cigarette smoking and arsenic exposure are strongly associated with squamous cell lung carcinoma.
synonyms: Epidermoid Cell Carcinoma of the Lung
Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Lung

results.name: Childhood Epithelioid Sarcoma
results.definition: An epithelioid sarcoma occurring in childhood.

results.name: Ovarian Teratoma
match: Germ Cell Teratoma of the Ovary
search: Germ Cell Teratoma of the Ovary
results.definition: A non-seminomatous germ cell tumor arising from the ovary. It is characterized by the presence of various tissues which correspond to the different germinal layers (endoderm, mesoderm, and ectoderm). According to the level of differentiation of the tissues which comprise the tumor, ovarian teratomas are classified as mature or immature. Mature teratomas are composed of well differentiated, adult-type tissues. Immature teratomas are composed of immature, fetal type-tissues. Mature ovarian teratomas without a fetal-type component have an excellent outcome. The prognosis of immature ovarian teratomas is related to the grade and stage of the tumor.
synonyms: Germ Cell Teratoma of the Ovary

results.name: Hemophilia B
results.definition: An X-linked inherited bleeding disorder caused by deficiency of the coagulation factor IX.
results.glossary_definition: A deficiency of blood coagulation factor IX inherited as an X-linked disorder. (Also known as Christmas Disease, after the first patient studied in detail, not the holy day.) Historical and clinical features resemble those in classic hemophilia (HEMOPHILIA A), but patients present with fewer symptoms. Severity of bleeding is usually similar in members of a single family. Many patients are asymptomatic until the hemostatic system is stressed by surgery or trauma. Treatment is similar to that for hemophilia A. (From Cecil Textbook of Medicine, 19th ed, p1008)

results.name: Vulvar Leiomyosarcoma
results.definition: An aggressive malignant smooth muscle neoplasm, arising from the vulva. It is characterized by a proliferation of neoplastic spindle cells.

results.name: Hemophilia A
results.definition: An inherited deficiency of coagulation factor VIII characterized by the tendency to spontaneous or exaggerated post-traumatic hemorrhage. Inherited as an X-linked recessive disease, hemophilia A is the most common hemophilia, occurring in approximately 1 in 10,000 male births.

results.name: Malignant Rectosigmoid Neoplasm
match: Malignant Neoplasm of the Rectosigmoid Junction
Malignant Tumor of the Rectosigmoid Junction
search: Malignant Neoplasm of the Rectosigmoid Junction
Malignant Tumor of the Rectosigmoid Junction
results.definition: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm that affects the rectosigmoid area. Representative examples include carcinoma, lymphoma, and sarcoma.
synonyms: Malignant Neoplasm of the Rectosigmoid Junction
Malignant Tumor of the Rectosigmoid Junction

results.name: Cerebral Hemisphere Lipoma
results.definition: A rare benign adipose tissue neoplasm within the cerebral hemisphere often associated with partial or complete agenesis of the corpus callosum.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Brain Oligodendroglioma
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Skin Sarcoma
results.definition: A sarcoma that arises from the skin. Representative examples include Kaposi sarcoma, angiosarcoma, lymphangiosarcoma, liposarcoma, and leiomyosarcoma.

results.name: Bartonella Infection
results.definition: A gram-negative bacterial infection caused by Bartonella bacilliformis. It is transmitted by ticks, flies and mosquitoes. Signs and symptoms include fever, headache, muscle pain, enlargement of the lymph nodes and anemia.

results.name: Combat Neurosis
results.glossary_definition: Neurotic reactions to unusual, severe, or overwhelming military stress.

results.name: Echinococcosis
results.definition: A parasitic infection caused by tapeworm larvae of Echinococcus. It affects livestock and humans. It is characterized by the formation of hydatid cysts mainly in the liver, lungs, spleen, and kidneys. Rupture of the cysts may lead to shock.

results.name: Trichinosis
results.definition: A parasitic infection caused by larvae of worms of the genus Trichinella. It is transmitted to humans by ingesting raw or undercooked meat from infected animals. Signs and symptoms include abdominal discomfort, nausea, vomiting, fever, diarrhea, headache, coughing, myalgias, arthralgias, and eye swelling.

results.name: Aagenaes Syndrome
results.definition: A rare genetic syndrome which occurs primarily among individuals of Norwegian descent with an autosomal recessive pattern of inheritance. It is caused, in some cases, by the inheritance of a mutation of the LSC1 gene on chromosome 15. Clinical signs include lymphedema of the lower extremities and cholestasis. The clinical course includes giant-cell hepatitis and progression to cirrhosis.

results.name: Lymphangitis
results.definition: Inflammation of the lymphatic vessels.

results.name: Pericardial Mesothelioma
results.definition: A rare neoplasm of mesothelial origin that arises from the pericardium.
A carcinoma arising from the exocrine pancreas. The overwhelming majority of pancreatic carcinomas are adenocarcinomas.
results.glossary_definition: A disease in which malignant (cancer) cells are found in the tissues of the pancreas.
results.name: Pancreatic Carcinoma
Peptic Ulcer
results.definition: A mucosal erosion that occurs in the esophagus, stomach or duodenum. Symptoms can include abdominal pain, nausea and vomiting, and bleeding.
results.glossary_definition: A break in the lining of the lower part of the esophagus, the stomach, or the upper part of the small intestine. Peptic ulcers form when cells on the surface of the lining become inflamed and die. They are usually caused by Helicobacter pylori bacteria and by certain medicines, such as aspirin and other nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs). Peptic ulcers may be linked to cancer and other diseases.

results.name: Hemangioma of the Central Nervous System
results.name_text: Hemangioma of the Central Nervous System
match: Hemangioma of the Central Nervous System
Hemangioma of the Central Nervous System
search: Hemangioma of the Central Nervous System
Hemangioma of the Central Nervous System
results.definition: A hemangioma arising from the brain and spinal cord.
synonyms: Hemangioma of the Central Nervous System
parents: Central Nervous System Mesenchymal Non-meningothelial Tumor
ancestors: Central Nervous System Mesenchymal Non-meningothelial Tumor

results.name: Intestinal Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the small or large intestine.

results.name: Internal Strabismus
results.definition: A form of strabismus in which one or both eyes are deviated medially.
results.glossary_definition: A form of strabismus in which one or both eyes are deviated medially.

results.name: Abducens Nerve Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the abducens nerve (sixth cranial nerve).
results.glossary_definition: A disorder characterized by involvement of the abducens nerve (sixth cranial nerve).

results.name: Occult Small Cell Lung Carcinoma
match: Occult Small Cell Carcinoma of Lung
Occult Small Cell Carcinoma of the Lung
search: Occult Small Cell Carcinoma of Lung
Occult Small Cell Carcinoma of the Lung
results.definition: A small cell lung carcinoma detectable by sputum cytology only. The primary tumor is undetectable radiographically or during bronchoscopy; therefore, it can not be assessed.
synonyms: Occult Small Cell Carcinoma of Lung
Occult Small Cell Carcinoma of the Lung

results.name: Subacute Lymphocytic Thyroiditis
results.definition: Thyroiditis associated with painless enlargement of the thyroid gland. It occurs more frequently in females and is characterized by alterations between hyperthyroidism and hypothyroidism and the eventual return to normal thyroid gland function.

results.name: Inner Ear Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the inner ear. Causes are inner ear infections, head injuries, and neoplasms (e.g., acoustic schwannoma). Symptoms include dizziness, imbalance, nausea, and vision problems.
results.glossary_definition: A disorder characterized by dizziness, imbalance, nausea, and vision problems.

results.name: Peripheral Nervous System Neoplasm
match: Neoplasm of the Peripheral Nervous System
Tumor of the Peripheral Nervous System
search: Neoplasm of the Peripheral Nervous System
Tumor of the Peripheral Nervous System
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm arising from a peripheral nerve or the perineural sheaths.
results.glossary_definition: Neoplasms which arise from peripheral nerve tissue. This includes NEUROFIBROMAS; SCHWANNOMAS; GRANULAR CELL TUMORS; and malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumors. (From DeVita Jr et al., Cancer: Principles and Practice of Oncology, 5th ed, pp1750-1)
synonyms: Neoplasm of the Peripheral Nervous System
Tumor of the Peripheral Nervous System

results.name: Cervical Mucinous Adenocarcinoma, Signet Ring Cell Variant
results.name_text: Cervical Mucinous Adenocarcinoma, Signet Ring Cell Variant
match: Cervical Mucinous Adenocarcinoma, Signet Ring Cell Variant
Cervical Mucinous Adenocarcinoma, Signet Ring Cell Variant
Cervical Mucinous Adenocarcinoma, Signet Ring Cell Type
search: Cervical Mucinous Adenocarcinoma, Signet Ring Cell Variant
Cervical Mucinous Adenocarcinoma, Signet Ring Cell Variant
Cervical Mucinous Adenocarcinoma, Signet Ring Cell Type
results.definition: A rare cervical mucinous adenocarcinoma characterized by the presence of signet ring cells.
synonyms: Cervical Mucinous Adenocarcinoma, Signet Ring Cell Variant
Cervical Mucinous Adenocarcinoma, Signet Ring Cell Type

results.name: Childhood Pleomorphic Rhabdomyosarcoma
results.definition: A rare aggressive rhabdomyosarcoma occurring in children. The neoplasm is characterized by the presence of bizarre round, spindle, and polygonal cells.

results.name: Anal Mucinous Adenocarcinoma
results.definition: An anal adenocarcinoma characterized by the presence of mucoid stroma formation.

results.name: Medulloblastoma with Extensive Nodularity
match: Medulloblastoma with Extensive Nodularity and Advanced Neuronal Differentiation
search: Medulloblastoma with Extensive Nodularity and Advanced Neuronal Differentiation
results.definition: A medulloblastoma characterized by nodularity and neuronal differentiation.
synonyms: Medulloblastoma with Extensive Nodularity and Advanced Neuronal Differentiation

results.name: Loffler Syndrome
results.definition: A transient inflammatory pulmonary disorder characterized by eosinophilia. Eosinophilic infiltration of the lungs may be secondary to parasitic infection or drug hypersensitivity. Clinical signs include dry cough, fever and dyspnea. Prognosis is favorable as the disorder follows a self-limited course.

results.name: Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma
results.definition: Distinct from Hodgkin lymphoma both morphologically and biologically, non-Hodgkin lymphoma (NHL) is characterized by the absence of Reed-Sternberg cells, can occur at any age, and usually presents as a localized or generalized lymphadenopathy associated with fever and weight loss. The clinical course varies according to the morphologic type. NHL is clinically classified as indolent, aggressive, or having a variable clinical course. NHL can be of B-or T-/NK-cell lineage.
results.glossary_definition: Any of a large group of cancers of lymphocytes (white blood cells). NHLs can occur at any age and are often marked by lymph nodes that are larger than normal, fever, and weight loss. There are many different types of NHL. These types can be divided into aggressive (fast-growing) and indolent (slow-growing) types, and they can be formed from either B-cells or T-cells. B-cell NHLs include Burkitt lymphoma, chronic lymphocytic leukemia/small lymphocytic lymphoma (CLL/SLL), diffuse large B-cell lymphoma, follicular lymphoma, immunoblastic large cell lymphoma, precursor B-lymphoblastic lymphoma, and mantle cell lymphoma. T-cell NHLs include mycosis fungoides, anaplastic large cell lymphoma, and precursor T-lymphoblastic lymphoma. Lymphomas that occur after bone marrow or stem cell transplantation are usually B-cell NHLs. Prognosis and treatment depend on the stage and type of disease.

results.name: Trilateral Retinoblastoma
results.definition: Trilateral retinoblastoma refers to bilateral (or less often unilateral) retinoblastoma associated with an intracranial primitive neuroectodermal tumor in the pineal or suprasellar region. This syndrome is often associated with a increased familial incidence of retinoblastoma. (From Cancer 86(1): 135-141, 1999).

results.name: Papillary Ependymoma
results.definition: A rare variant of ependymoma characterized by well formed papillae. Tumor cell processes abutting capillaries are usually GFAP-positive. Differential diagnoses include choroid plexus papilloma, papillary meningioma and metastatic papillary carcinoma. (Adapted from WHO)
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Angle Closure Glaucoma
results.definition: The sudden increase of intraocular pressure, resulting in pain and an abrupt decrease in visual acuity.
results.glossary_definition: Optic nerve damage secondary to appositional closure of the angle of the eye.

results.name: VACTERL Association
match: Vertebral Abnormalities, Anal Atresia, Cardiac Abnormalities, Tracheo-Esophageal Fistula, Renal Anomalies, Limb Defects Syndrome
search: Vertebral Abnormalities, Anal Atresia, Cardiac Abnormalities, Tracheo-Esophageal Fistula, Renal Anomalies, Limb Defects Syndrome
results.definition: An association of congenital birth defects that includes vertebral abnormalities, anal atresia, cardiac abnormalities, tracheo-esophageal fistula, renal abnormalities, and limb abnormalities.
synonyms: Vertebral Abnormalities, Anal Atresia, Cardiac Abnormalities, Tracheo-Esophageal Fistula, Renal Anomalies, Limb Defects Syndrome

results.name: Tuberculosis
results.definition: A chronic, recurrent infection caused by the bacterium Mycobacterium tuberculosis. Tuberculosis (TB) may affect almost any tissue or organ of the body with the lungs being the most common site of infection. The clinical stages of TB are primary or initial infection, latent or dormant infection, and recrudescent or adult-type TB. Ninety to 95% of primary TB infections may go unrecognized. Histopathologically, tissue lesions consist of granulomas which usually undergo central caseation necrosis. Local symptoms of TB vary according to the part affected; acute symptoms include hectic fever, sweats, and emaciation; serious complications include granulomatous erosion of pulmonary bronchi associated with hemoptysis. If untreated, progressive TB may be associated with a high degree of mortality. This infection is frequently observed in immunocompromised individuals with AIDS or a history of illicit IV drug use.
results.glossary_definition: A disease caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis infection that is characterized by the growth of nodules in body tissues, most commonly the lungs, and may be transmitted through droplets from the throat or lungs of individuals with the active respiratory disease.

results.name: Antithrombin III Deficiency
results.definition: A rare disorder characterized by the presence of low levels of antithrombin III which prohibits the formation of blood clots. It may be inherited, usually in an autosomal dominant pattern, or acquired. It may lead to venous thrombosis and pulmonary embolism.

results.name: Mastocytoma
results.definition: A localized tumor composed of sheets of mast cells without atypia. It includes the cutaneous mastocytoma which involves the dermis and subcutaneous tissue, and the extracutaneous mastocytoma. Most cases of extracutaneous mastocytoma have been reported in the lung.
results.glossary_definition: A growth or lump of mast cells (a type of white blood cell). Mast cell tumors can involve the skin, subcutaneous tissue, and muscle tissue.

results.name: Chronic Cholangitis
results.definition: Cholangitis that is persistent and long-standing.

results.name: Lumbar Intraspinal Meningioma
match: Lumbar Spinal Canal and Spinal Cord Meningioma
Meningioma of Lumbar Spinal Canal and Spinal Cord
Meningioma of the Lumbar Spinal Canal and Spinal Cord
search: Lumbar Spinal Canal and Spinal Cord Meningioma
Meningioma of Lumbar Spinal Canal and Spinal Cord
Meningioma of the Lumbar Spinal Canal and Spinal Cord
results.definition: A meningioma that arises from the meninges of the lumbar region of the spinal cord.
synonyms: Lumbar Spinal Canal and Spinal Cord Meningioma
Meningioma of Lumbar Spinal Canal and Spinal Cord
Meningioma of the Lumbar Spinal Canal and Spinal Cord
parents: Spinal Canal And Spinal Cord Meningioma
ancestors: Spinal Canal And Spinal Cord Meningioma

results.name: Mixed Cellularity Classical Hodgkin Lymphoma
results.definition: A subtype of classical Hodgkin lymphoma with scattered Reed-Sternberg and Hodgkin cells in a diffuse or vaguely nodular mixed inflammatory background without nodular sclerosing fibrosis. (WHO, 2008)

results.name: Rumination Disorder
results.definition: An eating disorder most commonly observed in infants characterized by the repeated regurgitation and rechewing of food for a period of at least one month; this behavior is not associated with a gastrointestinal or other medical reason.
results.glossary_definition: Unintentional and reflexive regurgitation and rechewing of undigested food.

results.name: Cellular Schwannoma
results.definition: A morphologic variant of schwannoma characterized by hypercellularity, Antoni A pattern, and the absence of well-formed Verocay bodies.
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Idiopathic Thrombocytopenic Purpura
results.definition: An autoimmune disorder in which the number of circulating platelets is reduced due to their antibody-mediated destruction. ITP is a diagnosis of exclusion and is heterogeneous in origin.
results.glossary_definition: A condition in which platelets (blood cells that cause blood clots to form) are destroyed by the immune system. The low platelet count causes easy bruising and bleeding, which may be seen as purple areas in the skin, mucous membranes, and outer linings of organs.

results.name: Malignant Breast Neoplasm
results.definition: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm involving the breast. The vast majority of cases are carcinomas arising from the breast parenchyma or the nipple. Malignant breast neoplasms occur more frequently in females than in males.

results.name: Ovalocytosis
results.definition: A peripheral blood finding in which a large number of erythrocytes are shaped in a slightly oval-shaped form.

results.name: Malignant Prostate Phyllodes Tumor
match: Malignant Phyllodes Neoplasm of the Prostate
Malignant Phyllodes Tumor of the Prostate
search: Malignant Phyllodes Neoplasm of the Prostate
Malignant Phyllodes Tumor of the Prostate
results.definition: An unusual malignant tumor that arises from the prostate gland. It is characterized by the presence of glandular elements and a cellular stroma that exhibits mitotic activity and nuclear atypia.
synonyms: Malignant Phyllodes Neoplasm of the Prostate
Malignant Phyllodes Tumor of the Prostate

results.name: Mediastinal Leiomyoma
results.definition: A benign smooth muscle neoplasm arising from the mediastium. It is characterized by the presence of spindle cells with cigar-shaped nuclei, interlacing fascicles, and a whorled pattern.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Melanoacanthoma
results.definition: A benign, darkly pigmented skin lesion characterized by proliferation of keratinocytes and melanocytes.

results.name: Trigeminal Nerve Neoplasm
match: Neoplasm of the Fifth Cranial Nerve
Tumor of the Fifth Cranial Nerve
search: Neoplasm of the Fifth Cranial Nerve
Tumor of the Fifth Cranial Nerve
results.definition: Benign and malignant neoplasms which arise from or metastasize to the trigeminal or fifth cranial nerve which provides sensory innervation to the face, oral cavity and sinuses and the muscles of mastication. Clinical features may include facial pain or sensory loss or weakness of jaw closure.
synonyms: Neoplasm of the Fifth Cranial Nerve
Tumor of the Fifth Cranial Nerve

results.name: Necatoriasis
results.definition: A disorder caused by an infection with hookworms of the genus Necator, which settle in the host's small intestine, and cause abdominal pain, diarrhea, weight loss, and anemia.
results.glossary_definition: Infection of humans or animals with hookworms of the genus NECATOR. The resulting anemia from this condition is less severe than that from ANCYLOSTOMIASIS.

results.name: Intraductal Papilloma
results.definition: An intraluminal papillary epithelial neoplasm arising within the ducts. Representative examples are the intraductal breast papilloma and the salivary gland intraductal papilloma.
results.glossary_definition: A benign (not cancer), wart-like growth in a milk duct of the breast. It is usually found close to the nipple and may cause a discharge from the nipple. It may also cause pain and a lump in the breast that can be felt. It usually affects women aged 35-55 years. Having a single papilloma does not increase the risk of breast cancer. When there are multiple intraductal papillomas, they are usually found farther from the nipple. There may not be a nipple discharge and the papillomas may not be felt. Having multiple intraductal papillomas may increase the risk of breast cancer.

results.name: Machado-Joseph Disease
results.definition: A very rare, autosomal dominant inherited neurodegenerative disorder. Signs and symptoms include ataxia, spasticity, and abnormalities in the ocular movements.

results.name: Corneal Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the cornea. Representative examples include keratitis, bullous keratopathy, and squamous cell carcinoma.

results.name: Anterior Visual Pathway Meningioma
results.definition: A meningioma that affects the anterior visual pathway.

results.name: Supratentorial Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor
results.definition: A central nervous system embryonal tumor, not otherwise specified arising from the supratentorial region.

results.name: Apical Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
results.name_text: Apical Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
match: Apical Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Apical Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Apical Myocardial Infarction by EKG Finding
search: Apical Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Apical Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Apical Myocardial Infarction by EKG Finding
results.definition: An electrocardiographic finding of an injury in leads corresponding to the anatomic region of the apex of the heart.
synonyms: Apical Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Apical Myocardial Infarction by EKG Finding

results.name: Coccidioidomycosis
results.definition: A fungal infection caused by Coccidioides immitis. Affected individuals usually have mild flu-like symptoms. However, pneumonia and systemic involvement with the formation of abscesses may develop as complications of the disease.

results.name: Echolalia
results.definition: A symptom of neurologic or psychiatric dysfunction in which the individual involuntarily and meaninglessly repeats a recently heard word, series of words, or a song.
results.glossary_definition: Involuntarily repeating of other peoples words.

results.name: Phyllodes Tumor
results.definition: A benign, borderline, or malignant fibroepithelial neoplasm arising from the breast and rarely the prostate gland. It may recur following resection. The recurrence rates are higher for borderline and malignant phyllodes tumors. In borderline and malignant phyllodes tumors metastases to distant anatomic sites can occur. The incidence of metastases is higher in malignant phyllodes tumors.
results.glossary_definition: A type of tumor found in breast or prostate tissue. It is often large and bulky and grows quickly. It may be benign (not cancer) or malignant (cancer) and may spread to other parts of the body.

results.name: Cataract
results.definition: Partial or complete opacity of the crystalline lens of one or both eyes that decreases visual acuity and eventually results in blindness. Some cataracts appear in infancy or in childhood, but most develop in older individuals. (Sternberg Diagnostic Surgical Pathology, 3rd ed.)
results.glossary_definition: A condition in which the lens of the eye becomes cloudy. Symptoms include blurred, cloudy, or double vision; sensitivity to light; and difficulty seeing at night. Without treatment, cataracts can cause blindness. There are many different types and causes of cataracts. They may occur in people of all ages, but are most common in the elderly.

results.name: Acute Hemorrhagic Encephalitis
results.definition: Acute encephalitis that is characterized by bleeding.

results.name: Childhood Central Nervous System Mixed Germ Cell Tumor
results.name_text: Childhood Central Nervous System Mixed Germ Cell Tumor
match: Childhood Central Nervous System Mixed Germ Cell Tumor
Childhood Central Nervous System Mixed Germ Cell Tumor
search: Childhood Central Nervous System Mixed Germ Cell Tumor
Childhood Central Nervous System Mixed Germ Cell Tumor
results.definition: A mixed germ cell tumor that arises from the central nervous system and occurs during childhood.
synonyms: Childhood Central Nervous System Mixed Germ Cell Tumor
parents: Central Nervous System Mixed Germ Cell Tumor
Central Nervous System Childhood Germ Cell Tumor
ancestors: Central Nervous System Mixed Germ Cell Tumor
Malignant Central Nervous System Germ Cell Tumor
Central Nervous System Germ Cell Tumor
Central Nervous System Childhood Germ Cell Tumor

results.name: Angioedema
results.definition: Rapid swelling of the deep layers of the skin due to transient vascular leakage of serous fluid.
results.glossary_definition: Rapid swelling of the deep layers of the skin due to transient vascular leakage of serous fluid.

results.name: Ectopic Thymus
results.definition: A condition in which the thymus gland is abnomally located; this can be secondary to failure of descent during fetal development, or failure of involution.

results.name: Superior Vena Cava Leiomyosarcoma
match: Leiomyosarcoma of the Superior Vena Cava
search: Leiomyosarcoma of the Superior Vena Cava
results.definition: An aggressive malignant smooth muscle neoplasm, arising from the superior vena cava. It is characterized by a proliferation of neoplastic spindle cells.
synonyms: Leiomyosarcoma of the Superior Vena Cava

results.name: Non-Gestational Ovarian Choriocarcinoma
results.definition: A malignant germ cell tumor that arises from the ovary and is composed of cytotrophoblasts, syncytiotrophoblasts, and extravillous trophoblasts. The prognosis is less favorable than gestational choriocarcinoma.

results.name: Hereditary Multiple Exostoses
results.definition: Hereditary disorder transmitted by autosomal dominant genes (EXT1-3) and characterized by multiple exostoses (multiple osteochondromas) near the ends of long bones. The genetic abnormality results in a defect in the osteoclastic activity at the metaphyseal ends of the bone during the remodeling process in childhood or early adolescence. The metaphyses develop benign, bony outgrowths often capped by cartilage. A small number undergo neoplastic transformation.

results.name: Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, Not Otherwise Specified
results.name_text: Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, Not Otherwise Specified
match: Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, Not Otherwise Specified
Infiltrating Ductal Carcinoma of the Breast
Invasive Ductal Carcinoma of the Breast
Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, No Specific Type
Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, Not Otherwise Specified
search: Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, Not Otherwise Specified
Infiltrating Ductal Carcinoma of the Breast
Invasive Ductal Carcinoma of the Breast
Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, No Specific Type
Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, Not Otherwise Specified
results.definition: The most common type of invasive breast carcinoma, accounting for approximately 70% of breast carcinomas. The gross appearance is usually typical with an irregular stellate outline. Microscopically, randomly arranged epithelial elements are seen. When large sheets of malignant cells are present, necrosis may be seen. With adequate tissue sampling, in situ carcinoma can be demonstrated in association with the infiltrating carcinoma. The in situ component is nearly always ductal but occasionally may be lobular or both.
results.glossary_definition: The most common type of invasive breast cancer. It starts in the cells that line the milk ducts in the breast, grows outside the ducts, and often spreads to the lymph nodes.
synonyms: Infiltrating Ductal Carcinoma of the Breast
Invasive Ductal Carcinoma of the Breast
Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, No Specific Type
Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, Not Otherwise Specified

results.name: Rectal Sarcomatoid Carcinoma
results.definition: A biphasic rectal carcinoma with a spindle cell, sarcomatoid component.

results.name: Chest Wall Lipoma
results.definition: A benign adipose tissue neoplasm of the chest wall.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Hypertensive Retinopathy
results.definition: Retinopathy due to hypertension.

A malignant tumor arising from the epithelium that lines the cavity of the uterine body. The vast majority of endometrial carcinomas are adenocarcinomas; squamous cell and adenosquamous carcinomas represent a minority of the cases. Endometrioid adenocarcinoma is the most frequently seen variant of endometrial adenocarcinoma. Uterine bleeding is an initial clinical sign. The prognosis depends on the stage of the tumor, the depth of myometrial wall invasion, and the degree of differentiation.
results.glossary_definition: Cancer that forms in the tissue lining the uterus (the small, hollow, pear-shaped organ in a woman's pelvis in which a fetus develops). Most endometrial cancers are adenocarcinomas (cancers that begin in cells that make and release mucus and other fluids).
results.name: Endometrial Carcinoma
Proteinuria
results.definition: The presence of abnormal amounts of protein in the urine.
results.glossary_definition: The presence of excessive protein in the urine.

results.name: Uterine Corpus PEComa
match: Uterine Corpus Perivascular Epithelioid Cell Tumor
search: Uterine Corpus Perivascular Epithelioid Cell Tumor
results.definition: A neoplasm with perivascular epithelioid cell differentiation arising from the uterine corpus wall.
synonyms: Uterine Corpus Perivascular Epithelioid Cell Tumor

results.name: Cardiomyopathy
results.definition: A disease of the heart muscle or myocardium proper. Cardiomyopathies may be classified as either primary or secondary, on the basis of etiology, or on the pathophysiology of the lesion: hypertrophic, dilated, or restrictive.
results.glossary_definition: A disease of the heart muscle.

results.name: Chronic Eosinophilic Pneumonia
results.definition: Chronic inflammatory disorder of the lungs characterized by the presence of eosinophils in the interalveolar septa and alveolar spaces and peripheral blood eosinophilia. Chest x-rays reveal peripheral infiltrates. Approximately half of the patients have history of asthma or atopic disease. Signs and symptoms include fever, dyspnea, cough, and weight loss. Following treatment with corticosteroids, the eosinophilic infiltrates in the lungs disappear, resulting in dramatic clinical improvement.

results.name: Endometrial Squamous Cell Carcinoma
match: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Endometrium
search: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Endometrium
results.definition: A primary carcinoma of the endometrium characterized by the presence of malignant squamous cells.
synonyms: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Endometrium

results.name: Oculocutaneous Albinism
results.definition: An autosomal recessive inherited disorder caused by mutations of the OCA2, SLC45A2, TYR and TYRP1 genes. It is characterized by hypopigmentation of the skin, hair, and eyes, resulting in very fair skin, white colored hair, and reduced pigmentation in the iris and retina. Individuals may have vision disturbances and photophobia.

results.name: Proximal-Type Epithelioid Sarcoma
results.definition: An epithelioid sarcoma predominantly involving the pelvis, perineum, and genital organs. It tends to have a more aggressive clinical course as compared to the more frequently seen distal-type epithelioid sarcoma.

results.name: Adult Central Nervous System Mixed Germ Cell Tumor
results.name_text: Adult Central Nervous System Mixed Germ Cell Tumor
match: Adult Central Nervous System Mixed Germ Cell Tumor
Adult Central Nervous System Mixed Germ Cell Tumor
search: Adult Central Nervous System Mixed Germ Cell Tumor
Adult Central Nervous System Mixed Germ Cell Tumor
synonyms: Adult Central Nervous System Mixed Germ Cell Tumor
parents: Central Nervous System Mixed Germ Cell Tumor
Central Nervous System Adult Germ Cell Tumor
ancestors: Central Nervous System Mixed Germ Cell Tumor
Malignant Central Nervous System Germ Cell Tumor
Central Nervous System Germ Cell Tumor
Central Nervous System Adult Germ Cell Tumor

results.name: Malignant Pericytic Neoplasm
results.definition: A malignant mesenchymal neoplasm arising from the perivascular cells of the connective and soft tissues. It is characterized by the presence of pericytes that grow in a circumferential pattern around vessels, and cytologic atypia.

results.name: Intraventricular Meningioma
results.definition: A meningioma that affects the ventricles of the brain.

results.name: Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
results.definition: A syndrome of unknown etiology. Chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS) is a clinical diagnosis characterized by an unexplained persistent or relapsing chronic fatigue that is of at least six months' duration, is not the result of ongoing exertion, is not substantially alleviated by rest, and results in substantial reduction of previous levels of occupational, educational, social, or personal activities. Common concurrent symptoms of at least six months duration include impairment of memory or concentration, diffuse pain, sore throat, tender lymph nodes, headaches of a new type, pattern, or severity, and nonrestorative sleep. The etiology of CFS may be viral or immunologic. Neurasthenia and fibromyalgia may represent related disorders. Also known as myalgic encephalomyelitis.
results.glossary_definition: A condition lasting for more than 6 months in which a person feels tired most of the time and may have trouble concentrating and carrying out daily activities. Other symptoms include sore throat, fever, muscle weakness, headache, and joint pain.

results.name: Extrahepatic Bile Duct Adenocarcinoma
match: Adenocarcinoma of the Extrahepatic Bile Duct
search: Adenocarcinoma of the Extrahepatic Bile Duct
results.definition: An adenocarcinoma arising from the epithelium of the extrahepatic bile ducts. Signs and symptoms include abdominal pain, anorexia, jaundice, pruritus, nausea and vomiting, and weight loss.
synonyms: Adenocarcinoma of the Extrahepatic Bile Duct
children: Extrahepatic Bile Duct Clear Cell Adenocarcinoma
Extrahepatic Bile Duct Signet Ring Cell Carcinoma

results.name: Gonadal Dysgenesis
results.definition: A congenital disorder characterized by the presence of extremely hypoplastic gonads preventing the development of secondary sex characteristics.
results.glossary_definition: Abnormal development of a gonad (ovary or testicle). Men with gonadal dysgenesis have a greater risk of developing testicular cancer. Gonadal dysgenesis is usually part of a genetic syndrome.

results.name: Malignant Ovarian Brenner Tumor
match: Malignant Brenner Tumor of the Ovary
search: Malignant Brenner Tumor of the Ovary
results.definition: A malignant neoplasm that arises from the ovary and is characterized by the presence of an invasive malignant transitional cell component and nests of benign transitional cells in a fibrotic stroma. When the neoplasm is confined to the ovary, the prognosis is good.
synonyms: Malignant Brenner Tumor of the Ovary

results.name: Chordoma
results.definition: A malignant bone tumor arising from the remnants of the fetal notochord. Although it can occur at all ages, it is more frequently seen in middle-aged adults. The most frequent sites of involvement are the sacrococcygeal area, spheno-occipital area, and cervico-thoraco-lumbar spine. Microscopically, chordomas are composed of cells that form cords and lobules, separated by mucoid intercellular tissue. Some of the cells are large (physaliphorous) and have vacuolated cytoplasm and prominent vesicular nuclei. Other tumor cells are small with small nuclei without visible nucleoli. Chordomas tend to recur and may metastasize. The most common sites of metastasis are the skin and bone.
results.glossary_definition: A type of bone cancer that usually starts in the lower spinal column or at the base of the skull.
ancestors: Malignant Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Acute Intermittent Porphyria
results.definition: A genetic metabolic disorder inherited in an autosomal dominant pattern. It is caused by a deficiency of the enzyme porphobilinogen deaminase, which is involved in heme biosynthesis. Signs and symptoms include nausea, vomiting, severe abdominal pain and distension, urinary retention, port-wine urine discoloration, hypertension, tachycardia, muscle weakness, loss of sensation, anxiety, depression, and arm, leg and back pain.

results.name: Benign Mucous Membrane Pemphigoid
results.definition: A chronic autoimmune disorder characterized by the development of blisters and ulcers in mucous membranes. It affects most often the gums, eyelids and genital mucosa sites.
results.glossary_definition: A chronic blistering disease with predilection for mucous membranes and less frequently the skin, and with a tendency to scarring. It is sometimes called ocular pemphigoid because of conjunctival mucous membrane involvement.

results.name: Carcinoma Arising in Nasal Papillomatosis
results.definition: A rare squamous cell carcinoma that either arises from or is associated with the presence of inverted papilloma in the nose.
ancestors: Nasal Cavity and Paranasal Sinus Carcinoma
Paranasal Sinus and Nasal Cavity Cancer

results.name: Skull Base Meningioma
results.definition: A meningioma that arises from the skull base.

results.name: Cerebrovascular Accident
results.definition: A sudden loss of neurological function secondary to hemorrhage or ischemia in the brain parenchyma due to a vascular event.
results.glossary_definition: In medicine, a loss of blood flow to part of the brain, which damages brain tissue. Strokes are caused by blood clots and broken blood vessels in the brain. Symptoms include dizziness, numbness, weakness on one side of the body, and problems with talking, writing, or understanding language. The risk of stroke is increased by high blood pressure, older age, smoking, diabetes, high cholesterol, heart disease, atherosclerosis (a build-up of fatty material and plaque inside the coronary arteries), and a family history of stroke.

results.name: Myelomeningocele
results.definition: A congenital abnormality in which the spinal cord and meninges protrude through a defect in the spinal column. The protrusion is above the skin surface.
results.glossary_definition: Incomplete closure of the spinal column during central nervous system development with protrusion of a hernial cyst containing meninges, spinal cord, or both.

results.name: Childhood Dermatomyositis
results.definition: An inflammatory myopathy of childhood resulting in muscle weakness, and associated with a characteristic skin rash.
results.glossary_definition: An inflammatory myopathy of childhood resulting in symmetric proximal muscle weakness, and associated with characteristic cutaneous findings, such as heliotrope rash or Gottron's papules.

results.name: Non-Functioning Pituitary Gland Neoplasm
match: Non-Functioning Neoplasm of the Pituitary Gland
Non-Functioning Tumor of the Pituitary Gland
search: Non-Functioning Neoplasm of the Pituitary Gland
Non-Functioning Tumor of the Pituitary Gland
results.definition: A hormone producing or non-producing pituitary gland adenoma or carcinoma, not associated with a hormonal syndrome.
synonyms: Non-Functioning Neoplasm of the Pituitary Gland
Non-Functioning Tumor of the Pituitary Gland

results.name: Conjunctival Squamous Cell Carcinoma
match: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Conjunctiva
search: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Conjunctiva
results.definition: A low-grade squamous cell carcinoma that arises from the conjunctiva. It is the most common primary malignant tumor that arises from the conjunctiva. It usually affects older white males. Excessive exposure to sunlight is a risk factor. Patients may present with a mass, red eye, or pain.
synonyms: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Conjunctiva

results.name: Breast Apocrine Adenoma
results.definition: A rare, benign and well circumscribed neoplasm that arises from the breast. It is characterized by the proliferation of epithelial cells with extensive apocrine metaplasia.

results.name: Fallopian Tube Adenocarcinoma
results.definition: An adenocarcinoma that arises from the fallopian tube. Histologic subtypes include clear cell, endometrioid, serous, and mucinous adenocarcinoma. It spreads to adjacent organs, regional lymph nodes, and peritoneum.

results.name: Childhood T-Cell Lymphoblastic Leukemia/Lymphoma
results.definition: A T lymphoblastic leukemia/lymphoma that occurs during childhood.

results.name: Malignant Cardiac Hemangiopericytoma
results.definition: A malignant hemangiopericytoma arising in the heart.

results.name: Uterine Corpus Cellular Leiomyoma
results.definition: A morphologic variant of leiomyoma arising from the uterine corpus. It is characterized by a dense cellular infiltrate composed of spindle or round cells with scant cytoplasm and a less obvious interlacing fascicle pattern.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Autoimmune Hemolytic Anemia
results.definition: An acquired anemia caused by destruction of the red blood cells by autoantibodies. Causes include autoimmune disorders, lymphoproliferative disorders, and infections.
results.glossary_definition: A condition in which the body's immune system stops red blood cells from forming or causes them to clump together. Autoimmune hemolytic anemia can occur in patients who have chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL).

results.name: Ovarian Epithelial Tumor
results.definition: A benign, borderline, or malignant tumor that originates from the surface epithelium of the ovary. It is composed of epithelial cells and stroma. Representative examples of benign tumors include serous cystadenoma, mucinous cystadenoma, and benign Brenner tumor. Representative examples of borderline tumors include serous surface papillary tumor, mucinous adenofibroma, and borderline Brenner tumor. Representative examples of malignant tumors include serous adenocarcinoma, mucinous adenocarcinoma, endometrioid adenocarcinoma, and malignant Brenner tumor.

results.name: Impetigo
results.definition: A contagious bacterial cutaneous infection that affects children and is usually caused by Staphylococcus aureus. It usually presents in the face with honey colored scabs.
results.glossary_definition: A bacterial skin infection characterized by red sores or blisters that progress to a honey colored crust.

results.name: Sphenoid Sinus Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the sphenoid sinus. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include Schneiderian papilloma and salivary gland-type adenoma. Representative examples of malignant neoplasms include carcinoma and lymphoma.

results.name: Gastric Pylorus Carcinoma
match: Cancer of the Pylorus of the Stomach
Carcinoma of the Pylorus of the Stomach
search: Cancer of the Pylorus of the Stomach
Carcinoma of the Pylorus of the Stomach
results.definition: A carcinoma that arises from the pylorus.
synonyms: Cancer of the Pylorus of the Stomach
Carcinoma of the Pylorus of the Stomach

results.name: Mast Cell Leukemia
results.definition: A variant of systemic mastocytosis with involvement of the bone marrow (20% or more mast cells) and the peripheral blood (mast cells account for 10% or more of peripheral blood white cells). (WHO, 2001)

results.name: Dental Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic (benign or malignant) disorder affecting the teeth.

results.name: Vulvar Squamous Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign, precancerous, or malignant neoplasm that arises from the squamous epithelium of the vulva. Representative examples include vestibular papilloma, intraepithelial neoplasia, and squamous cell carcinoma.

results.name: Juvenile Breast Papillomatosis
results.definition: A benign, usually solitary, well circumscribed multicystic neoplasm that arises from the breast and typically affects young females. The cysts are lined by papillary proliferations that contain epithelial and myoepithelial layers. In a minority of cases, atypia may be present.

results.name: Cervical Adenosquamous Carcinoma, Glassy Cell Variant
results.name_text: Cervical Adenosquamous Carcinoma, Glassy Cell Variant
match: Cervical Adenosquamous Carcinoma, Glassy Cell Variant
Glassy Cell Carcinoma of the Cervix
Cervical Adenosquamous Carcinoma, Glassy Cell Variant
search: Cervical Adenosquamous Carcinoma, Glassy Cell Variant
Glassy Cell Carcinoma of the Cervix
Cervical Adenosquamous Carcinoma, Glassy Cell Variant
results.oncotree_disease: Glassy Cell Carcinoma of the Cervix
results.definition: A poorly differentiated variant of adenosquamous carcinoma that arises from the cervix. It is characterized by the presence of large malignant cells with ground glass cytoplasm and stromal eosinophilic infiltrates.
synonyms: Cervical Adenosquamous Carcinoma, Glassy Cell Variant

results.name: Intussusception
results.definition: Telescoping or invagination of a part of the intestine into an adjacent segment.
results.glossary_definition: Telescoping or invagination of a part of the intestine into an adjacent segment.

results.name: Mixed Astrocytoma-Ependymoma-Oligodendroglioma
results.definition: A mixed glioma characterized by the presence of astrocytic, ependymal, and oligodendroglial neoplastic components.
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Paget Disease of the Anal Canal
results.name_text: Paget Disease of the Anal Canal
match: Paget Disease of the Anal Canal
Paget Disease of the Anal Canal
Paget's Disease of the Anal Canal
search: Paget Disease of the Anal Canal
Paget Disease of the Anal Canal
Paget's Disease of the Anal Canal
results.definition: Paget disease involving the squamous epithelium of the anal canal.
synonyms: Paget Disease of the Anal Canal
Paget's Disease of the Anal Canal

results.name: Anterior Urethral Malignant Neoplasm
match: Malignant Neoplasm of the Anterior Urethra
Malignant Tumor of the Anterior Urethra
search: Malignant Neoplasm of the Anterior Urethra
Malignant Tumor of the Anterior Urethra
results.definition: A malignant neoplasm that affects the portion of the urethra that is close to the outside of the body.
results.glossary_definition: A disease in which malignant (cancer) cells are found in the part of the urethra (the tube through which urine leaves the body) that is closest to the outside of the body.
synonyms: Malignant Neoplasm of the Anterior Urethra
Malignant Tumor of the Anterior Urethra

results.name: Paraneoplastic Polyneuropathy
results.definition: A diffuse or multifocal peripheral neuropathy caused by the effects of a distant neoplasm. It may be attributed, in part, to the immune response to neoplasm-elaborated proteins. The neuropathy may be sensory, motor, mixed or autonomic. It may be the initial presentation of an occult neoplasm. Detection and resection of the neoplasm may result in cure.
results.glossary_definition: A diffuse or multifocal peripheral neuropathy related to the remote effects of a neoplasm, most often carcinoma or lymphoma. Pathologically, there are inflammatory changes in peripheral nerves. The most common clinical presentation is a symmetric distal mixed sensorimotor polyneuropathy. (Adams et al., Principles of Neurology, 6th ed, p1334)

results.name: Hemolytic Anemia
results.definition: Anemia resulting from the premature destruction of the peripheral blood red cells. It may be congenital or it may be caused by infections, medications, or malignancies.
results.glossary_definition: due to premature destruction of erythrocytes in the spleen or peripheral vessels; commonly associated with glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase deficiencies, splenomegaly, and malarial or other infections.

results.name: Endometrial Mucinous Adenocarcinoma
results.definition: A primary, usually low grade adenocarcinoma of the endometrium in which the majority of the malignant epithelial cells contain abundant intracytoplasmic mucin.

results.name: Nontoxic Goiter
results.definition: Sporadic enlargement of the thyroid gland that is not associated with changes in thyroid function or malignancy.

results.name: Orbit Cavernous Hemangioma
results.definition: A cavernous hemangioma arising from the orbit.

results.name: Phenylketonuria
results.definition: An autonomic recessive genetic disorder characterized by the body's inability to metabolize and utilize the amino acid phenylalanine, resulting in mental retardation, behavioral and movement problems, seizures, and developmental delays.
results.glossary_definition: An inherited disorder that causes a build-up of phenylalanine (an amino acid) in the blood. This can cause mental retardation, behavioral and movement problems, seizures, and delayed development. Using a blood test, PKU can easily be found in newborns, and treatment is a diet low in phenylalanine.

results.name: Vulvar Keratinizing Squamous Cell Carcinoma
results.definition: A squamous cell carcinoma that arises from the vulva and is characterized by the presence of keratin pearls.

results.name: Prostate Embryonal Rhabdomyosarcoma
results.definition: A malignant mesenchymal neoplasm of the prostate. It is characterized by the presence of skeletal muscle exhibiting embryonic features.

results.name: Bacillary Angiomatosis
results.definition: A condition that is caused by infection with Bartonella, and which is characterized by vascular proliferation, usually in immunocompromised individuals.
results.glossary_definition: An infectious bacterial disease characterized by cutaneous vascular lesions. It is caused by BARTONELLA HENSELAE and is seen in AIDS patients and other immunocompromised hosts.

results.name: Chronic Gingivitis
results.definition: Chronic painless inflammation of the gums. It is characterized by erythema and edema of the gums and bleeding while brushing the teeth.

results.name: Cystitis
results.definition: Inflammation of the urinary bladder.
results.glossary_definition: Inflammation of the urinary bladder. (Dorland, 27th ed)

results.name: Intraorbital Meningioma
results.definition: A meningioma that affects the intraorbital structures.
ancestors: Malignant Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Pleomorphic Adenoma
results.definition: A neoplasm characterized by the presence of benign epithelial and myoepithelial cells and a mesenchymal component that may contain mucoid, myxoid, cartilaginous, or osseous areas. It may be completely or partially encapsulated. It occurs in the parotid gland, submandibular gland, minor salivary glands in the oral cavity, upper respiratory tract, and nasal cavity and paranasal sinuses. It usually presents as a slow growing painless mass. Infrequently, patients may present with pain and facial palsy. It may recur after excision or transform to a malignant neoplasm (carcinoma ex pleomorphic adenoma).
results.glossary_definition: A benign neoplasm composed of epithelial and/or myoepithelial cells and a mesenchymal component.

results.name: Gastric Lymphoma
results.definition: An extranodal lymphoma that arises from the stomach with the bulk of the mass located in the stomach. The vast majority of cases are diffuse large B-cell lymphomas and B-cell lymphomas of the mucosa-associated lymphoid tissue.

results.name: Bacterial Conjunctivitis
results.definition: Inflammation of the conjunctiva caused by a variety of bacterial agents.

results.name: Testicular Leydig Cell Tumor
match: Leydig Cell Neoplasm of the Testis
Leydig Cell Tumor of the Testis
search: Leydig Cell Neoplasm of the Testis
Leydig Cell Tumor of the Testis
results.definition: A sex cord-stromal tumor that arises from the testis and is characterized by the presence of cells that resemble the successive stages of development of Leydig cells. It usually presents as a painless testicular mass. Gynecomastia is present in approximately thirty percent of the cases. Libido may be decreased. In children, precocious puberty may be present. A minority of cases exhibit malignant characteristics.
synonyms: Leydig Cell Neoplasm of the Testis
Leydig Cell Tumor of the Testis

results.name: Hyperimmunoglobulin E Syndrome
results.definition: A condition that is characterized by elevated serum IgE, dermatitis, and respiratory infections.
results.glossary_definition: A disorder of neutrophils characterized by the presence of abnormal or absent chemotactic responses and hyperimmunoglobulinemia E. It is transmitted as an autosomal recessive trait and most cases reported have been in girls.

results.name: Rectosigmoid Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the rectosigmoid region. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include lipoma and leiomyoma. Representative examples of malignant neoplasms include carcinoma, lymphoma, and sarcoma. Rectosigmoid adenomas always exhibit epithelial dysplasia and are considered premalignant neoplasms.

results.name: Kluver-Bucy Syndrome
results.definition: A rare syndrome resulting from damage to both temporal lobes of the brain. Signs and symptoms include oral exploratory behavior, docility, altered sexuality, dietary changes, and visual agnosia.

results.name: Malignant Melanotic Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor of the Mediastinum
results.name_text: Malignant Melanotic Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor of the Mediastinum
match: Malignant Melanotic Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor of the Mediastinum
Malignant Mediastinal Melanocytic Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor
Malignant Melanocytic Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor of Mediastinum
Malignant Melanotic Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor of the Mediastinum
search: Malignant Melanotic Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor of the Mediastinum
Malignant Mediastinal Melanocytic Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor
Malignant Melanocytic Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor of Mediastinum
Malignant Melanotic Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor of the Mediastinum
results.definition: A rare variant of malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumor that arises from the mediastinum. It is characterized by the presence of malignant cells that contain melanin.
synonyms: Malignant Mediastinal Melanocytic Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor
Malignant Melanocytic Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor of Mediastinum
Malignant Melanotic Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor of the Mediastinum
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Crohn Disease of Small Intestine
results.definition: Crohn's disease affecting the small intestine.

results.name: Deep Hemangioma
results.definition: A hemangioma arising from the deep soft tissues.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Pancreatitis
results.definition: Inflammation of the pancreas.
results.glossary_definition: Inflammation of the pancreas. Chronic pancreatitis may cause diabetes and problems with digestion. Pain is the primary symptom.

results.name: Spermatocele
results.definition: A benign cystic dilatation in the head of the epididymis that contains milky or watery fluid and spermatozoa.
results.glossary_definition: A benign cystic dilatation in the epididymis or testis that contains fluid and spermatozoa.

results.name: Testicular Torsion
results.definition: An emergency condition caused by the twisting of the spermatic cord which contains the vessels that provide the blood supply to the testis and surrounding structures. It manifests with acute testicular pain. If immediate medical assistance is not provided, it will lead to necrosis and loss of the testicular tissue.
results.glossary_definition: Torsion of the spermatic cord caused usually by incomplete attachment of the epididymis to the testis or by inclusion of the cord within the tunica vaginalis. Faulty development of various anatomical components of the testes is also a cause. It occurs most frequently in childhood and adolescence. (From Current Medical Information & Terminology, 5th ed)

results.name: Inferolateral Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
results.name_text: Inferolateral Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
match: Inferolateral Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Inferolateral Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Inferolateral Myocardial Infarction by EKG Finding
search: Inferolateral Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Inferolateral Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Inferolateral Myocardial Infarction by EKG Finding
results.definition: An electrocardiographic finding of an injury in leads corresponding to the anatomic region of the inferolateral wall of the heart.
synonyms: Inferolateral Myocardial Infarction by ECG Finding
Inferolateral Myocardial Infarction by EKG Finding

results.name: Alpha-Mannosidosis
results.definition: An autosomal recessive lysosomal storage disease characterized by deficient activity of the enzyme alpha-D-mannosidase. There is a wide range of signs and symptoms including hepatomegaly, splenomegaly, hearing loss, respiratory infections, mental retardation, skeletal abnormalities, leveled nasal bridge and protruding forehead.

results.name: External Ear Squamous Cell Carcinoma
match: Epidermoid Carcinoma of the External Ear
Squamous Cell Carcinoma of External Ear
Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the External Ear
search: Epidermoid Carcinoma of the External Ear
Squamous Cell Carcinoma of External Ear
Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the External Ear
results.definition: A squamous cell carcinoma that arises from the skin of the external ear.
synonyms: Epidermoid Carcinoma of the External Ear
Squamous Cell Carcinoma of External Ear
Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the External Ear

results.name: Chronic Conjunctivitis
results.definition: Conjunctivitis that is persistent and long-standing.

results.name: Fibroblastic Osteosarcoma
results.definition: A conventional osteosarcoma characterized by the presence of spindle shaped cells.
ancestors: Malignant Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Liver Angiosarcoma
results.definition: A malignant vascular neoplasm arising from the liver.
ancestors: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Malignant Nonepithelial Neoplasm
Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Neoplasm

results.name: Gallbladder Leiomyosarcoma
results.definition: An aggressive malignant smooth muscle neoplasm, arising from the gallbladder. It is characterized by a proliferation of neoplastic spindle cells.

results.name: Alcoholic Hepatitis
results.definition: Inflammation of the liver resulting from ingestion of alcohol.

results.name: Trochlear Nerve Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the trochlear nerve (IVth cranial nerve).
results.glossary_definition: A disorder characterized by involvement of the trochlear nerve (fourth cranial nerve).

results.name: Oculomotor Nerve Paralysis
results.definition: Paralysis of the oculomotor nerve.

results.name: Endometrial Serous Adenocarcinoma
match: Uterine Serous Carcinoma/Uterine Papillary Serous Carcinoma
search: Uterine Serous Carcinoma/Uterine Papillary Serous Carcinoma
results.oncotree_disease: Uterine Serous Carcinoma/Uterine Papillary Serous Carcinoma
results.definition: A high grade, aggressive adenocarcinoma arising from the endometrium. It is characterized by the presence of complex papillary patterns with cellular budding. Atypical mitoses, necrosis, and psammoma bodies may be present. It is classified as type II endometrial carcinoma and it is not associated with endometrial hyperplasia. It tends to invade deeply into the myometrium and spreads into the lymphatic vessels. Patients frequently present with spread of the tumor beyond the uterus at the time of diagnosis. The prognosis is usually poor.

results.name: Gliofibroma
results.definition: An astrocytic tumor affecting young people. Morphologically, it is characterized by the presence of collagenous tissue surrounding neoplastic astrocytes. In some cases the collagen is produced by the tumor cells (desmoplastic astrocytoma), whereas in others it is produced by mesenchymal cells (mixed glioma/fibroma).
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Pseudomembranous Conjunctivitis
results.definition: Conjunctivitis that is characterized by formation of a pseudomembrane.

results.name: Hyperprolactinemia
results.definition: Abnormally high level of prolactin in the blood.
results.glossary_definition: Abnormally high level of prolactin in the blood.

results.name: Substance-Related Disorder
results.definition: A category of psychiatric disorders which include disorders related to the taking of a drug of abuse (including alcohol, prescribed medications and recreational drugs).

results.name: Kidney Leiomyosarcoma
results.definition: An aggressive malignant smooth muscle neoplasm, arising from the kidney. It is characterized by a proliferation of neoplastic spindle cells.

results.name: Stage 0 Gastric Cancer
match: Carcinoma in situ of the Stomach
search: Carcinoma in situ of the Stomach
results.definition: Stage 0 includes: Tis, N0, M0. Tis: Carcinoma in situ: intraepithelial tumor without invasion of the lamina propria. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)
results.glossary_definition: Abnormal cells are found in the inside lining of the mucosal (innermost) layer of the stomach wall. These abnormal cells may become cancer and spread into nearby normal tissue.
synonyms: Carcinoma in situ of the Stomach

results.name: Ovarian Yolk Sac Tumor, Hepatoid Pattern
results.name_text: Ovarian Yolk Sac Tumor, Hepatoid Pattern
match: Ovarian Yolk Sac Tumor, Hepatoid Pattern
Ovarian Yolk Sac Tumor, Hepatoid Pattern
search: Ovarian Yolk Sac Tumor, Hepatoid Pattern
Ovarian Yolk Sac Tumor, Hepatoid Pattern
results.definition: A yolk sac tumor that arises from the ovary and is characterized by the presence of extensive differentiation into hepatic tissue.
synonyms: Ovarian Yolk Sac Tumor, Hepatoid Pattern

results.name: Malignant Uvula Neoplasm
results.definition: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm that affects the uvula.

results.name: Macular Corneal Dystrophy
results.definition: A stromal corneal dystrophy, with autosomal recessive inheritance, that is caused by lack of or abnormal keratan sulfate.

results.name: Tetanus
results.definition: A serious infectious disorder that follows wound contamination by the Gram-positive bacterium Clostridium tetani. The bacteria produce a neurotoxin called tetanospasmin, which causes muscle spasm in the jaw and other anatomic sites.

results.name: Retroperitoneal Hemangiopericytoma
results.definition: A benign or malignant hemangiopericytoma arising from the retroperitoneum.

results.name: Photosensitive Dermatitis
results.definition: Dermatitis caused or precipitated by exposure to ultraviolet sunlight, or by mediating phototoxic or photoallergic material in response to ultraviolet sunlight.
results.glossary_definition: Abnormal responses to sunlight or artificial light due to extreme reactivity of light-absorbing molecules in tissues. It refers almost exclusively to skin photosensitivity, including sunburn, reactions due to repeated prolonged exposure in the absence of photosensitizing factors, and reactions requiring photosensitizing factors such as photosensitizing agents and certain diseases. With restricted reference to skin tissue, it does not include photosensitivity of the eye to light, as in photophobia or photosensitive epilepsy.

results.name: Urethral Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the urethra. Urethra carcinoma is a representative example.

results.name: Dysembryoplastic Neuroepithelial Tumor
results.definition: A benign glial-neuronal neoplasm. It is usually supratentorial, located, generally, in the cortex and occurs in children and young adults with a long-standing history of partial seizures. A histologic hallmark of this tumor is the 'specific glioneuronal element', characterized by columns, made up of bundles of axons, oriented perpendicularly to the cortical surface. (Adapted from WHO)
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Benign Muscle Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign mesenchymal neoplasm arising from smooth, skeletal, or cardiac muscle tissue.
parents: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Endocrine System Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the endocrine system.
