Pregerminal Center Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia/Small Lymphocytic Lymphoma
results.definition: A recently recognized variant of chronic lymphocytic leukemia/small lymphocytic lymphoma (CLL/SLL) that lacks somatic hypermutations of the Immunoglobulin heavy chain (IGH) genes, implying pregerminal center B-cell origin. Microarray gene expression profiling studies have demonstrated the expression of ZAP-70 gene (Syk family tyrosine kinase) in this subset of CLL/CLL. Patients with this variant of CLL/SLL have an unfavorable prognosis compared to those with somatic hypermutations of the IGH genes, with a median survival of approximately 6-8 years.
synonyms: Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia/Small Lymphocytic Lymphoma with Unmutated Immunoglobulin Heavy Chain Variable-Region Gene
Pregerminal Center Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia/Small Lymphocytic Lymphoma

results.name: Ichthyosis Vulgaris
results.definition: The most common form of ichthyosis. It is an autosomal dominant inherited or acquired disorder characterized by scaling and desquamation of the skin.

results.name: Interstitial Myocarditis
results.definition: Inflammation of the heart characterized by infiltration of the interstitial tissues by inflammatory cells, histiocytes, and the formation of granulomas. Giant cells are often present.

results.name: Congestive Heart Failure
results.definition: Failure of the heart to pump a sufficient amount of blood to meet the needs of the body tissues, resulting in tissue congestion and edema. Signs and symptoms include shortness of breath, pitting edema, enlarged tender liver, engorged neck veins, and pulmonary rales.
results.glossary_definition: Weakness of the heart muscle that leads to a buildup of fluid in body tissues.

results.name: POEMS Syndrome
results.definition: A syndrome characterized by polyneuropathy, organomegaly, endocrinopathy, monoclonal gammopathy, and skin changes. It is often associated with osteosclerotic myeloma.

results.name: Hyperthyroidism
results.definition: Overactivity of the thyroid gland resulting in overproduction of thyroid hormone and increased metabolic rate. Causes include diffuse hyperplasia of the thyroid gland (Graves' disease), single nodule in the thyroid gland, and thyroiditis. The symptoms are related to the increased metabolic rate and include weight loss, fatigue, heat intolerance, excessive sweating, diarrhea, tachycardia, insomnia, muscle weakness, and tremor.
results.glossary_definition: Too much thyroid hormone. Symptoms include weight loss, chest pain, cramps, diarrhea, and nervousness.

results.name: Maxillary Sinusitis
results.definition: An acute or chronic inflammatory process affecting the mucous membrane of the maxillary sinus.
results.glossary_definition: Inflammation of the maxillary sinus. In most cases it is the result of infection by the bacteria HAEMOPHILUS INFLUENZAE; STREPTOCOCCUS PNEUMONIAE; and STAPHYLOCOCCUS AUREUS. This condition may be acute or chronic.

results.name: Childhood Brain Meningioma
results.definition: A brain meningioma that occurs during childhood.

results.name: Fallopian Tube Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the fallopian tube. Representative examples of non-neoplastic disorders include salpingitis and endometriosis. Representative examples of neoplastic disorders include papilloma, adenofibroma, carcinoma, leiomyosarcoma, and carcinosarcoma.
results.glossary_definition: Diseases involving the FALLOPIAN TUBES including neoplasms (FALLOPIAN TUBE NEOPLASMS), SALPINGITIS, tubo-ovarian abscess and blockage.

results.name: Lacrimal Gland Carcinoma ex Pleomorphic Adenoma
results.name_text: Lacrimal Gland Carcinoma ex Pleomorphic Adenoma
match: Lacrimal Gland Carcinoma ex Pleomorphic Adenoma
Carcinoma ex Pleomorphic Adenoma of Lacrimal Gland
Carcinoma ex Pleomorphic Adenoma of the Lacrimal Gland
Lacrimal Gland Carcinoma ex Pleomorphic Adenoma
Malignant Mixed Neoplasm of Lacrimal Gland
Malignant Mixed Neoplasm of the Lacrimal Gland
Malignant Mixed Tumor of Lacrimal Gland
Malignant Mixed Tumor of the Lacrimal Gland

Carcinoma ex Pleomorphic Adenoma of Lacrimal Gland
Carcinoma ex Pleomorphic Adenoma of the Lacrimal Gland
Lacrimal Gland Carcinoma ex Pleomorphic Adenoma
Malignant Mixed Neoplasm of Lacrimal Gland
Malignant Mixed Neoplasm of the Lacrimal Gland
Malignant Mixed Tumor of Lacrimal Gland
Malignant Mixed Tumor of the Lacrimal Gland
results.definition: A carcinoma arising in a pre-existing pleomorphic adenoma in the lacrimal gland.
synonyms: Carcinoma ex Pleomorphic Adenoma of Lacrimal Gland
Carcinoma ex Pleomorphic Adenoma of the Lacrimal Gland
Lacrimal Gland Carcinoma ex Pleomorphic Adenoma
Malignant Mixed Neoplasm of Lacrimal Gland
Malignant Mixed Neoplasm of the Lacrimal Gland
Malignant Mixed Tumor of Lacrimal Gland
Malignant Mixed Tumor of the Lacrimal Gland

results.name: Quadriplegia
results.definition: Paralysis of all four limbs.
results.glossary_definition: Paralysis of all four limbs.

results.name: Horner Syndrome
results.definition: Interruption of sympathetic innervation to eye and face.
results.glossary_definition: A condition in which one side of the face is flushed, does not produce sweat, and has a constricted pupil and drooping eyelid. It can be caused by an injury to, or paralysis of, nerves in the neck, or by a tumor.

results.name: Glottis Verrucous Carcinoma
results.definition: An exophytic, slow growing, well differentiated and non-metastasizing squamous cell carcinoma with pushing margins that arises from the glottic area of the larynx. It usually presents with hoarseness.
ancestors: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma

results.name: Lung Mucoepidermoid Carcinoma
results.definition: A lung carcinoma characterized by the presence of malignant non-keratinizing squamoid cells, mucin-producing cells and intermediate type cells.

results.name: Cervical Adenosarcoma
results.definition: A rare malignant mixed epithelial and mesenchymal neoplasm that arises from the cervix and is characterized by the presence of malignant mesenchymal elements and benign epithelial elements.
parents: Malignant Cervical Mixed Epithelial and Mesenchymal Neoplasm
ancestors: Malignant Cervical Mixed Epithelial and Mesenchymal Neoplasm

results.name: Pancreatic Gastrin-Producing Neuroendocrine Tumor
results.definition: A usually malignant gastrin-producing neuroendocrine tumor arising from the pancreas. It may or may not be associated with inappropriate secretion of gastrin and an associated clinical syndrome.

results.name: Stomatitis
results.definition: Inflammation of the oral mucosa due to local or systemic factors.
results.glossary_definition: Inflammation or irritation of the mucous membranes in the mouth.

results.name: Falciparum Malaria
results.definition: Malaria resulting from infection by Plasmodium falciparum.
results.glossary_definition: Malaria caused by PLASMODIUM FALCIPARUM. This is the severest form of malaria and is associated with the highest levels of parasites in the blood. This disease is characterized by irregularly recurring febrile paroxysms that in extreme cases occur with acute cerebral, renal, or gastrointestinal manifestations.

results.name: Inflammatory Leiomyosarcoma
results.definition: A morphologic variant of leiomyosarcoma characterized by the presence of an inflammatory infiltrate admixed with malignant spindle cells.

results.name: Anemia of Prematurity
results.definition: A blood disorder characterized by low hemoglobin levels in premature neonates that usually spontaneously resolves within 3-6 months post birth. A combination of factors including the transition from the liver to the bone marrow for erythropoiesis in a neonate, blood loss experienced during delivery, the shortened life span of fetal blood cells, and an acclimation to a relatively hyperoxic environment outside the womb can predispose a neonate to this condition.

results.name: Encephalitis Lethargica
results.definition: A form of encephalitis, the etiology of which is uncertain, that is characterized by lethargy and headache.

results.name: Anal Margin Basal Cell Carcinoma
match: Basal Cell Carcinoma of Anal Margin
Basal Cell Carcinoma of Perianal Skin
Basal Cell Carcinoma of the Anal Margin
Basal Cell Carcinoma of the Perianal Skin
search: Basal Cell Carcinoma of Anal Margin
Basal Cell Carcinoma of Perianal Skin
Basal Cell Carcinoma of the Anal Margin
Basal Cell Carcinoma of the Perianal Skin
results.definition: A basal cell carcinoma arising from the perianal skin. Local excision is the treatment of choice. Metastases are extremely rare.
synonyms: Basal Cell Carcinoma of Anal Margin
Basal Cell Carcinoma of Perianal Skin
Basal Cell Carcinoma of the Anal Margin
Basal Cell Carcinoma of the Perianal Skin

results.name: Focal Dermal Hypoplasia
results.definition: A genetic multisystem disorder caused by mutations in the PORCN gene. It is characterized by atrophy and hypoplasia of skin, eye defects, face defects, skeletal abnormalities, and limb malformations.

results.name: Sandhoff Disease
results.definition: An autosomal recessive inherited lysosomal storage disorder caused by mutations in the HEXB gene. It is characterized by deficiency of the enzyme hexosaminidase, resulting in the accumulation of gangiosides in the central nervous system and other body tissues. Signs and symptoms include progressive motor and mental deterioration, early blindness, macrocephaly, seizures, and hepatosplenomegaly.

results.name: Mesenchymal Cell Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign, intermediate, or malignant neoplasm that arises from the mesenchyma-derived cells of the soft tissue or bone. Representative examples include lipoma, leiomyoma, leiomyosarcoma and osteosarcoma.

results.name: Cervical Polyp
match: Adenomatous Polyp of the Uterine Cervix
search: Adenomatous Polyp of the Uterine Cervix
results.definition: A polyp that arises from the surface of the cervix.
synonyms: Adenomatous Polyp of the Uterine Cervix

results.name: Laryngeal Small Cell Carcinoma
match: Small Cell Carcinoma of the Larynx
search: Small Cell Carcinoma of the Larynx
results.definition: A rare carcinoma that arises from the larynx. It is characterized by the presence of small neuroendocrine cells. It metastasizes early and has an aggressive clinical course.
synonyms: Small Cell Carcinoma of the Larynx

results.name: Inverted Transitional Cell Papilloma
results.definition: A benign papillary neoplasm composed of transitional cells and characterized by an endophytic growth pattern.

results.name: Biliary System Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the intrahepatic or extrahepatic bile ducts or the gallbladder. Representative examples of non-neoplastic disorders include cholangitis and cholecystitis. Representative examples of neoplastic disorders include extrahepatic bile duct adenoma, intrahepatic and extrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma, and gallbladder carcinoma.

results.name: Pilomyxoid Astrocytoma
results.definition: An astrocytic tumor of uncertain relation to pilocytic astrocytoma. It occurs predominantly in infants and young children. It is characterized by a monomorphic architectural pattern, usually associated with the absence of Rosenthal fibers and eosinophilic granular bodies. The clinical course is usually aggressive.
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Infiltrating Lipoma
results.definition: A benign tumor, composed of lobules of mature adipocytes, that penetrates the surrounding tissue from which it arises. There is usually a higher local recurrence rate when compared with non-infiltrating lipomas.
ancestors: Benign Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Leiomyosarcoma
results.definition: An uncommon, aggressive malignant smooth muscle neoplasm, usually occurring in post-menopausal women. It is characterized by a proliferation of neoplastic spindle cells. Morphologic variants include epithelioid, granular cell, inflammatory and myxoid leimyosarcomas.
results.glossary_definition: A malignant (cancer) tumor of smooth muscle cells that can arise almost anywhere in the body, but is most common in the uterus, abdomen, or pelvis.

results.name: Salpingitis Isthmica Nodosa
results.definition: Formation of nodules in the isthmus of the fallopian tube due to fallopian tube diverticulosis. It may cause infertility or ectopic pregnancy.

results.name: Aphasia
results.definition: Impairment of the expression or comprehension of verbal and written language.
results.glossary_definition: Impairment of the expression or comprehension of verbal and written language.

results.name: Beckwith-Wiedemann Syndrome
results.definition: A genetic syndrome caused by abnormalities in chromosome 11. It is characterized by large birth weight, macroglossia, umbilical hernia, ear abnormalities, and hypoglycemia. Patients with this syndrome have an increased risk of developing embryonal tumors (gonadoblastoma, hepatoblastoma, Wilms tumor, Rhabdomyosarcoma) and adrenal cortex carcinomas.
results.glossary_definition: A rare, overgrowth disorder in which babies are large at birth and may develop low blood sugar. Other common symptoms are a large tongue, large internal organs, and defects of the abdominal wall near the navel. Beckwith-Wiedemann syndrome increases the risk of developing certain cancers, especially Wilms tumor.

results.name: Bone Liposarcoma
results.definition: A very rare malignant adipose tissue neoplasm that arises from the bone.

results.name: Pyosalpinx
results.definition: The presence of pus in the fallopian tube. It is usually caused by acute salpingitis. The fallopian tube is distended and filled with pus. Histologic examination reveals edema and acute and chronic inflammation. Symptoms include fever, vaginal discharge, and pelvic pain.

results.name: Bladder Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma
match: Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of Urinary Bladder
Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Urinary Bladder
search: Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of Urinary Bladder
Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Urinary Bladder
results.definition: A highly aggressive carcinoma, histologically resembling small cell lung carcinoma. In most cases it is associated with carcinoma in situ.
synonyms: Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of Urinary Bladder
Small Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma of the Urinary Bladder

results.name: Adult Central Nervous System Choriocarcinoma
match: Choriocarcinoma of Adult Central Nervous System
Choriocarcinoma of the Adult Central Nervous System
search: Choriocarcinoma of Adult Central Nervous System
Choriocarcinoma of the Adult Central Nervous System
synonyms: Choriocarcinoma of Adult Central Nervous System
Choriocarcinoma of the Adult Central Nervous System
parents: Central Nervous System Adult Germ Cell Tumor
ancestors: Malignant Central Nervous System Germ Cell Tumor
Central Nervous System Germ Cell Tumor
Malignant Extragonadal Non-Seminomatous Germ Cell Tumor
Central Nervous System Adult Germ Cell Tumor

results.name: Childhood Mediastinal Neurogenic Neoplasm
match: Childhood Neurogenic Neoplasm of the Mediastinum
Childhood Neurogenic Tumor of the Mediastinum
Pediatric Neurogenic Neoplasm of the Mediastinum
Pediatric Neurogenic Tumor of the Mediastinum
search: Childhood Neurogenic Neoplasm of the Mediastinum
Childhood Neurogenic Tumor of the Mediastinum
Pediatric Neurogenic Neoplasm of the Mediastinum
Pediatric Neurogenic Tumor of the Mediastinum
synonyms: Childhood Neurogenic Neoplasm of the Mediastinum
Childhood Neurogenic Tumor of the Mediastinum
Pediatric Neurogenic Neoplasm of the Mediastinum
Pediatric Neurogenic Tumor of the Mediastinum

results.name: Erythropoietic Protoporphyria
results.definition: A rare congenital metabolic disorder characterized by an inborn error of porphyrin-heme biosynthesis. It is caused by deficiency of the enzyme ferrochelatase. Signs and symptoms include painful cutaneous photosensitivity leading to blistering and scarring of the exposed skin areas, erythrodontia, red discoloration of urine, hemolytic anemia, and splenomegaly.

results.name: Angiokeratoma
results.definition: A vascular lesion in the papillary dermis resulting from ectasia of pre-existing vessels. It is associated with secondary proliferative changes in the overlying epidermis (hyperkeratosis). It can present with widespread lesions (angiokeratoma corporis diffusum, often associated with inborn errors of metabolism) or as a localized lesion (angiokeratoma of Fordyce, angiokeratoma circumscriptum, and angiokeratoma of Mibelli).

results.name: Hunter Syndrome
results.definition: An X-linked, inherited lysosomal storage disease caused by the deficiency of the enzyme iduronate sulfatase that is responsible for the degradation of mucopolysaccharides. It nearly always affects males and is characterized by the accumulation of mucopolysaccharides in various organs, resulting in mental dysfunction, enlarged abdomen, hearing loss, obstructive airway disease, heart disease, and hepatosplenomegaly.

results.name: Hyperlipoproteinemia Type I
results.definition: A genetic disorder of lipoprotein metabolism caused by mutations in the LPL and apolipoprotein (apo) C-II genes. It is characterized by increased levels of chylomicrons and triglycerides in the blood.

results.name: Cystic Nephroma
results.definition: A benign encapsulated neoplasm of the kidney, characterized by the presence of cysts separated by septa. There are no solid areas present. The septa are lined by one layer of epithelial cells that have eosinophilic or clear cytoplasm. The cystic spaces contain serous or hemorrhagic fluid.

results.name: Testicular Seminoma, Cribriform Variant
results.definition: A morphologic variant of testicular seminoma characterized by the presence of seminoma cells arranged in cribriform patterns and few lymphocytes.

results.name: Amblyopia
results.definition: Decreased vision that results from abnormal visual development.
results.glossary_definition: Decreased vision that results from abnormal visual development.

results.name: Choroid Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the choroid.
results.glossary_definition: Tumors of the choroid; most common intraocular tumors are malignant melanomas of the choroid. These usually occur after puberty and increase in incidence with advancing age. Most malignant melanomas of the uveal tract develop from benign melanomas (nevi).

results.name: Otitis Media
results.definition: Inflammation of the anatomical structures of the middle ear, which is most often caused by an infectious process. Symptoms include erythema and edema of the tympanic membrane, pain, and possibly fever.
results.glossary_definition: Inflammation of the middle ear.

results.name: Schizoid Personality Disorder
results.definition: A disorder characterized by an enduring pattern of extreme social detachment and lack of involvement in interpersonal activities, coupled with emotional coldness.

results.name: Canker Sore
results.definition: A recurrent disease of the oral mucosa of unknown etiology. It is characterized by small white ulcerative lesions, single or multiple, round or oval, lasting for 7-14 days and healing without scarring.
results.glossary_definition: A term used to describe oral, non-keratinized mucosal ulcerations that are shallow, round to oval with a grayish base, and are usually painful. Recurrent aphthous ulcers are often associated with predisposing factors such as stress, familial tendency, trauma, drug hypersensitivity, or underlying disease such as inflammatory bowel disease, systemic lupus erythematosus, and Behcet disease.

results.name: Endometrioid Stromal Neoplasm of the Cervix
results.name_text: Endometrioid Stromal Neoplasm of the Cervix
match: Endometrioid Stromal Neoplasm of the Cervix
Endometrioid Stromal Neoplasm of the Cervix
Endometrioid Stromal Tumor of the Cervix
search: Endometrioid Stromal Neoplasm of the Cervix
Endometrioid Stromal Neoplasm of the Cervix
Endometrioid Stromal Tumor of the Cervix
results.definition: A category of rare neoplasms that arise from the cervix. It includes low grade endometrioid stromal sarcoma and undifferentiated endocervical sarcoma.
synonyms: Endometrioid Stromal Neoplasm of the Cervix
Endometrioid Stromal Tumor of the Cervix
children: Low Grade Endometrioid Stromal Sarcoma of the Cervix

results.name: Gastroparesis
results.definition: Paralysis of the muscles of the stomach wall resulting in delayed emptying of the gastric contents into the small intestine.
results.glossary_definition: Paralysis of the muscles of the stomach wall resulting in delayed emptying of the gastric contents into the small intestine.

results.name: Bagassosis
results.definition: An occupational lung disorder caused by inhalation of bagasse dust. In the acute phase, it manifests as cough, dyspnea, fever, chills, and weakness. Chronic exposure may lead to interstitial lung fibrosis.

results.name: Fatal Familial Insomnia
results.definition: A very rare autosomal dominant inherited sleep disorder caused by a mutation in the gene responsible for the prion protein. It affects individuals usually in their fourth decade. Its initial manifestation is difficulty in falling asleep. It is followed by complete inability to sleep. Patients develop deterioration of their mental and motor functions and die soon after the first symptoms appear, because of the total absence of sleep.

results.name: Acute Hemorrhagic Conjunctivitis
results.definition: Acute conjunctivitis that is characterized by bleeding into the conjunctiva.

results.name: Actinomycosis
results.definition: An infectious process caused by bacteria of the Actinomyces species. It is characterized by the formation of purulent and painful abscesses in the mouth, lungs and gastrointestinal tract.

results.name: Pemphigus
results.definition: A blistering skin disorder. Morphologically it is characterized by acantholysis and intraepidermal blister formation.
results.glossary_definition: Group of chronic blistering diseases characterized histologically by acantholysis and blister formation within the epidermis.

results.name: Retroperitoneal Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the retroperitoneum.

results.name: Candida Esophagitis
results.definition: Esophagitis resulting from Candida.

results.name: Lung Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant, primary or metastatic neoplasm involving the lungs. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include adenoma, papilloma, chondroma, and endobronchial lipoma. Representative examples of malignant neoplasms include carcinoma, carcinoid tumor, sarcoma, and lymphoma.

results.name: Sweat Gland Adenocarcinoma
results.definition: A carcinoma arising from the sweat glands. Representative examples include tubular carcinoma, spiradenocarcinoma, eccrine carcinoma, hidradenocarcinoma, and apocrine carcinoma.
results.glossary_definition: A malignant neoplasm arising from sweat glands.

results.name: Stromal Predominant Kidney Wilms Tumor
results.definition: Wilms tumor of the kidney characterized by the predominance of the mesenchymal component.

results.name: Diabetes Mellitus
results.definition: A metabolic disorder characterized by abnormally high blood sugar levels due to diminished production of insulin or insulin resistance/desensitization.
results.glossary_definition: A disease in which the body does not control the amount of glucose (a type of sugar) in the blood and the kidneys make a large amount of urine. This disease occurs when the body does not make enough insulin or does not use it the way it should.

results.name: Endobronchial Leiomyoma
results.definition: A benign smooth muscle neoplasm arising endobronchially. It is characterized by the presence of spindle cells with cigar-shaped nuclei, interlacing fascicles, and a whorled pattern.

results.name: Digestive System Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the gastrointestinal tract, anus, liver, biliary system, and pancreas.

children: Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm in the Brain
results.name: Cancer
Thyroid Gland Microfollicular Adenoma
results.definition: A thyroid gland adenoma composed of microfollicular structures.

results.name: Leukemoid Reaction
results.definition: A hematology test result that indicates the presence of an increased white blood cell count and increased neutrophil precursors resembling leukemia, in a peripheral blood smear.
results.glossary_definition: A peripheral blood picture resembling that of leukemia or indistinguishable from it on the basis of morphologic appearance alone. (Dorland, 27th ed)

results.name: Monophasic Synovial Sarcoma
results.definition: A synovial sarcoma characterized by the presence of an epithelial or a spindle cell component only.

results.name: Coronary Artery Stenosis
results.definition: Narrowing of the coronary artery lumen diameter.

results.name: Eye Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm affecting the structures of the eye.
results.glossary_definition: Tumors or cancer of the EYE.

results.name: Kimura Disease
results.definition: A chronic, benign, inflammatory condition that is characterized by the swelling of lymph node in the head and neck.

results.name: Gallbladder Adenosquamous Carcinoma
results.definition: A carcinoma that arises from the gallbladder. It is characterized by the presence of glandular and squamous malignant epithelial components.

results.name: Secondary Hypertension
results.definition: High blood pressure caused by an underlying medical condition.

results.name: Coagulation Disorder
results.definition: A condition in which there is a deviation from or interruption of the normal coagulation properties of the blood.
results.glossary_definition: A condition of abnormal blood clotting or bleeding.

results.name: Hereditary Factor XII Deficiency Disease
results.definition: A rare autosomal recessive inherited bleeding disorder caused by deficiency of coagulation factor XII. It may be asymptomatic or manifest with bleeding.
results.glossary_definition: An absence or reduced level of blood coagulation factor XII. It normally occurs in the absence of patient or family history of hemorrhagic disorders and is marked by prolonged clotting time.

results.name: Lactic Acidosis
results.definition: Metabolic acidosis characterized by the accumulation of lactate in the body. It is caused by tissue hypoxia.

results.name: Cyclic Neutropenia
results.definition: A hematologic disorder caused by a mutation in the ELANE (ELA2) gene; clinical manifestations include recurrent neutropenia with resultant susceptibility to infection leading to fever.
results.glossary_definition: A chronic condition that affects neutrophils (a type of white blood cell). In cyclic neutropenia, the number of neutrophils in the blood goes in cycles from normal to low and back to normal again. Symptoms include fever, inflamed mucous membranes in the mouth, and infections.

results.name: Endometritis
results.definition: An acute or chronic, usually bacterial infectious process affecting the endometrium. It may extend to the myometrium and parametrial tissues. Symptoms include lower abdominal pain, vaginal discharge, and vaginal bleeding.
results.glossary_definition: Inflammation of the ENDOMETRIUM, usually caused by intrauterine infections. Endometritis is the most common cause of postpartum fever.

results.name: Signet Ring Cell Intrahepatic Cholangiocarcinoma
results.definition: An intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma characterized by the presence of signet ring adenocarcinoma cells.
ancestors: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Carcinoma
Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Epithelial Neoplasm
Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Neoplasm

results.name: Differentiating Neuroblastoma
results.definition: A neuroblastoma in which the differentiating neuroblasts constitute more than five-percent of the tumor cells.
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Scotoma
results.definition: An area of impaired sight within the normal visual field.
results.glossary_definition: An area of impaired sight within the normal visual field.

results.name: Fibroblastic Liposarcoma
results.definition: A liposarcoma characterized by the presence of a fibroblastic component.

A malignant, invasive embryonal neoplasm arising from the cerebellum. It occurs predominantly in children and has the tendency to metastasize via the cerebrospinal fluid pathways. Signs and symptoms include truncal ataxia, disturbed gait, lethargy, headache, and vomiting. There are four histologic variants: classic medulloblastoma, large cell/anaplastic medulloblastoma, desmoplastic/nodular medulloblastoma, and medulloblastoma with extensive nodularity.
results.glossary_definition: A malignant brain tumor that begins in the lower part of the brain and that can spread to the spine or to other parts of the body. Medulloblastomas are a type of primitive neuroectodermal tumor (PNET).
results.name: Medulloblastoma
Malignant Laryngeal Neoplasm
results.definition: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm involving the larynx. The majority are carcinomas.

results.name: Orbit Alveolar Rhabdomyosarcoma
results.definition: A malignant mesenchymal neoplasm that arises in the orbit. It is characterized by the presence of round cells with myoblastic differentiation and a fibrovascular stroma.
ancestors: Malignant Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Hypertropia
results.definition: Vertical strabismus in which there is permanent upward deviation of the visual axis of one eye.

results.name: Porphyria
results.definition: A group of genetic or acquired metabolic disorders characterized by defects in the enzymes that are involved in the heme synthesis.

results.name: Burning Mouth Syndrome
results.definition: A condition characterized by a burning or tingling sensation on the lips, tongue, or entire mouth.
results.glossary_definition: Pain in the mouth, not attributed to another disorder, that presents daily and persists for most of the day.

results.name: Cervical Serous Adenocarcinoma
results.definition: A rare adenocarcinoma that arises from the cervix. It is characterized by the presence of papillary patterns and cellular budding. Psammoma bodies are often seen.

results.name: Necrotic Uveal Melanoma
results.definition: A uveal melanoma characterized by the presence of tumor cell necrosis.

results.name: Brain Iron Accumulation Type I Syndrome
results.name_text: Brain Iron Accumulation Type I Syndrome
match: Brain Iron Accumulation Type I Syndrome
Brain Iron Accumulation Type I Syndrome
search: Brain Iron Accumulation Type I Syndrome
Brain Iron Accumulation Type I Syndrome
results.definition: A rare neuroaxonal dystrophy, histologically characterized by axonal spheroids, iron deposition, lewy body (LB)-like intraneuronal inclusions and neurofibrillary tangles.
synonyms: Brain Iron Accumulation Type I Syndrome

results.name: Childhood Central Nervous System Immature Teratoma
results.name_text: Childhood Central Nervous System Immature Teratoma
match: Childhood Central Nervous System Immature Teratoma
Childhood Central Nervous System Immature Teratoma
search: Childhood Central Nervous System Immature Teratoma
Childhood Central Nervous System Immature Teratoma
results.definition: An immature teratoma that arises from the central nervous system and occurs during childhood.
synonyms: Childhood Central Nervous System Immature Teratoma
ancestors: Malignant Extragonadal Non-Seminomatous Germ Cell Tumor
Malignant Central Nervous System Germ Cell Tumor
Central Nervous System Germ Cell Tumor

results.name: Arthritis
results.definition: An inflammatory process affecting a joint. Causes include infection, autoimmune processes, degenerative processes, and trauma. Signs and symptoms may include swelling around the affected joint and pain.
results.glossary_definition: A disease that causes inflammation and pain in the joints.

results.name: Tracheal Carcinoma In Situ
match: Carcinoma in situ of the Trachea
search: Carcinoma in situ of the Trachea
results.definition: A carcinoma that arises from the tracheal mucosa and is confined to the epithelial layer without evidence of further tissue invasion.
synonyms: Carcinoma in situ of the Trachea

results.name: Adenoma
results.definition: A neoplasm arising from the epithelium. It may be encapsulated or non-encapsulated but non-invasive. The neoplastic epithelial cells may or may not display cellular atypia or dysplasia. In the gastrointestinal tract, when dysplasia becomes severe it is sometimes called carcinoma in situ. Representative examples are pituitary gland adenoma, follicular adenoma of the thyroid gland, and adenomas (or adenomatous polyps) of the gastrointestinal tract.
results.glossary_definition: A tumor that is not cancer. It starts in gland-like cells of the epithelial tissue (thin layer of tissue that covers organs, glands, and other structures within the body).

results.name: Squamous Cell Breast Carcinoma, Acantholytic Variant
results.name_text: Squamous Cell Breast Carcinoma, Acantholytic Variant
match: Squamous Cell Breast Carcinoma, Acantholytic Variant
Squamous Cell Breast Carcinoma, Acantholytic Variant
search: Squamous Cell Breast Carcinoma, Acantholytic Variant
Squamous Cell Breast Carcinoma, Acantholytic Variant
results.definition: A squamous cell carcinoma that arises from the breast parenchyma and is characterized by cellular discohesion resulting in a pseudoangiosarcomatous pattern.
synonyms: Squamous Cell Breast Carcinoma, Acantholytic Variant

results.name: Breast Large Cell Neuroendocrine Carcinoma
results.definition: A poorly differentiated neuroendocrine carcinoma that arises from the breast. It is characterized by the presence of large neuroendocrine cells and high mitotic activity.

results.name: Ovarian Monodermal and Highly Specialized Teratoma
results.name_text: Ovarian Monodermal and Highly Specialized Teratoma
match: Ovarian Monodermal and Highly Specialized Teratoma
Ovarian Germ Cell Monodermal and Highly Specialized Teratoma
Ovarian Monodermal and Highly Specialized Teratoma
search: Ovarian Monodermal and Highly Specialized Teratoma
Ovarian Germ Cell Monodermal and Highly Specialized Teratoma
Ovarian Monodermal and Highly Specialized Teratoma
results.definition: A teratoma of the ovary composed exclusively or predominantly of a single type of tissue derived from the ectoderm or endoderm. A representative example is struma ovarii which is a teratoma composed exclusively or predominantly of thyroid tissue.
synonyms: Ovarian Germ Cell Monodermal and Highly Specialized Teratoma
Ovarian Monodermal and Highly Specialized Teratoma

results.name: Mesenchymal Chondrosarcoma
results.definition: A morphologic variant of chondrosarcoma arising from bone and soft tissue. It is characterized by the presence of malignant small round cells, biphasic growth pattern, and well differentiated hyaline cartilage. Clinical presentation includes pain and swelling. The clinical course is aggressive, with local recurrences and distant metastases.
ancestors: Malignant Connective and Soft Tissue Neoplasm

results.name: Ossifying Fibromyxoid Tumor
results.definition: A rare soft tissue tumor of uncertain lineage characterized by the presence of neoplastic spindle to round cells forming cords in a fibromyxoid stroma. The lesions are associated with the formation of metaplastic bone. Most patients present with painless subcutaneous masses. Recurrences have been reported in a minority of patients.

results.name: Early Invasive Cervical Adenocarcinoma
results.definition: A cervical adenocarcinoma with minimal stromal invasion. The risk of local lymph node metastasis is insignificant and the prognosis is excellent.

results.name: Irritable Bowel Syndrome
results.definition: Gastrointestinal symptoms characterized by chronic abdominal pain and altered bowel habits in the absence of any organic cause.
results.glossary_definition: A disorder of the intestines commonly marked by abdominal pain, bloating, and changes in a person's bowel habits. This may include diarrhea or constipation, or both, with one occurring after the other.

results.name: Mediastinitis
results.definition: An inflammatory process affecting the mediastinum.
results.glossary_definition: Inflammation of the mediastinum, the area between the pleural sacs.

results.name: Dermatophytosis
results.definition: A common fungal infection of the stratum corneum of the skin, hair, or nails by a dermatophyte. It is characterized by itching, inflammation, redness of the skin, small papular vesicles, central clearing, fissures, scaling, and/or hair loss in the affected area.
children: Dermatophytosis of Groin and Perianal Area

results.name: Extrahepatic Bile Duct Adenosquamous Carcinoma
match: Adenosquamous Carcinoma of the Bile Duct
search: Adenosquamous Carcinoma of the Bile Duct
results.definition: A carcinoma that arises from the extrahepatic bile ducts. It is characterized by the presence of glandular and squamous malignant epithelial components.
synonyms: Adenosquamous Carcinoma of the Bile Duct

results.name: Somatostatin-Producing Neuroendocrine Tumor
results.definition: A rare, usually malignant neuroendocrine tumor arizing from delta cells. This neoplasm produces large amounts of somatostatin, which may result in a syndrome characterized by diarrhea, steatorrhea, weight loss, and gastric hyposecretion. Sixty percent are found in the pancreas and 40% in the duodenum or jejunum. The peak incidence occurs between 40 and 60 years of age; women are affected more than men by 2:1.

results.name: Malignant Type A Thymoma
results.definition: A type A thymoma which is characterized by an aggressive clinical course (capsular invasion, infiltration of the surrounding tissues) and can metastasize.

results.name: Netherton Syndrome
results.definition: A rare autosomal recessive form of ichthyosis caused by mutations in the SPINK5 gene. Patients have spiky and fragile hair.

results.name: Villous Adenocarcinoma
results.definition: An adenocarcinoma characterized by the presence of a villous architectural pattern. It may arise from a villous adenoma.

results.name: Acinar Prostate Adenocarcinoma
results.definition: An invasive adenocarcinoma of the prostate gland composed of secretory cells. It is the most common histologic type of prostate adenocarcinoma. Several morphologic variants exist, including atrophic, pseudohyperplastic, foamy gland, and oncocytic variants.

results.name: Fallopian Tube Gestational Choriocarcinoma
match: Gestational Choriocarcinoma of the Fallopian Tube
search: Gestational Choriocarcinoma of the Fallopian Tube
results.definition: A malignant trophoblastic tumor that arises from the fallopian tube during pregnancy.
synonyms: Gestational Choriocarcinoma of the Fallopian Tube

results.name: Chronic Kidney Disease
results.definition: Impairment of the renal function secondary to chronic kidney damage persisting for three or more months.
results.glossary_definition: Chronic kidney disease is defined as either kidney damage or GFR less than 60 ml/min/1.73 m2 for greater than or equal to 3 months. Kidney damage is de?ned as pathologic abnormalities or markers of damage, including abnormalities in blood or urine tests or imaging studies.

results.name: Uterine Corpus Endometrial Stromal Sarcoma
results.definition: A uterine corpus sarcoma originating from the endometrial stroma. It is further subdivided into low grade and high grade endometrial stromal sarcoma.

results.name: Urethral Villous Adenoma
results.definition: An epithelial neoplasm of the urethra, which is morphologically characterized by the presence of a villous architectural pattern.

results.name: Urethral Squamous Cell Carcinoma
match: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Urethra
search: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Urethra
results.definition: A well differentiated, moderately differentiated, or poorly differentiated squamous cell carcinoma that arises from the male or female urethra.
synonyms: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Urethra

results.name: Malignant Apocrine Neoplasm
match: Malignant Apocrine Neoplasm of the Skin
Malignant Apocrine Tumor of the Skin
search: Malignant Apocrine Neoplasm of the Skin
Malignant Apocrine Tumor of the Skin
synonyms: Malignant Apocrine Neoplasm of the Skin
Malignant Apocrine Tumor of the Skin

results.name: Maxillary Sinus Cholesteatoma
results.definition: A rare, progressive, non-neoplastic pathologic process that arises from the maxillary sinus mucosal epithelium. It is characterized by the proliferation of keratinizing squamous epithelium and the formation of keratin sheets. It may lead to bone erosion and infections. Surgical removal is the appropriate treatment.

results.name: Nasopharyngeal Disorder
results.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the nasopharynx. Representative examples include nasopharyngitis, angiofibroma, and carcinoma.

results.name: Polyclonal Hypergammaglobulinemia
results.definition: A laboratory test result indicating abnormally high proliferation of gamma globulins in the blood originating from multiple cell lines.

results.name: Benign Vaginal Mixed Tumor
results.definition: A non-metastasizing, well circumscribed neoplasm that arises from the vagina and is characterized by the presence of a predominant benign mesenchymal component and benign glandular or squamous epithelial cells.
parents: Benign Vaginal Mixed Epithelial and Mesenchymal Neoplasm
ancestors: Benign Vaginal Mixed Epithelial and Mesenchymal Neoplasm

results.name: Central Retinal Vein Occlusion
results.definition: Blockage of the central retinal vein.
results.glossary_definition: Occlusion of central retinal vein.

results.name: Cystic Hygroma
results.definition: A benign lymphatic neoplasm usually arising from the neck and characterized by cystic dilation of the lymphatic vessels.

results.name: Mucosal Melanoma
results.definition: A melanoma that arises from a mucosal site.
children: Mucosal Melanoma of the Head and Neck

results.name: Thrombocytosis
results.definition: A hematology test result that indicates the presence of higher than normal platelet counts in the peripheral blood.
results.glossary_definition: Increased numbers of platelets in the peripheral blood. (Dorland, 27th ed)

results.name: Diffuse Infiltrative Lymphocytosis Syndrome
results.definition: This is usually an oligoclonal CD8+ lymphocytic infiltration of various organs.

results.name: Pancreatic Serous Cystadenocarcinoma
results.definition: A metastasizing, slow-growing malignant epithelial neoplasm that arises from the exocrine pancreas. It is characterized by the presence of cysts and is composed of glycogen-rich malignant epithelial cells which produce a watery fluid. Signs and symptoms include upper gastrointestinal bleeding, weight loss, jaundice, and abdominal pain.

results.name: Papillary Adenoma
results.definition: An adenoma characterized by the presence of papillary epithelial patterns.
results.glossary_definition: A benign epithelial neoplasm characterized by the presence of papillary epithelial patterns.

results.name: Dissociative Disorder
results.definition: A category of psychiatric disorders which are characterized by a disruption in the usually integrated functions of consciousness, memory, identity, and/or perception of the environment.

results.name: Liver Sarcoma
results.definition: A malignant soft tissue neoplasm that arises from the liver. Representative examples include angiosarcoma, undifferentiated (embryonal) sarcoma, rhabdomyosarcoma, and leiomyosarcoma.
parents: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Malignant Nonepithelial Neoplasm
ancestors: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Malignant Nonepithelial Neoplasm
Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Neoplasm

results.name: Choroid Plexus Meningioma
results.definition: A meningioma that affects the choroid plexus.

results.name: Familial Dysautonomia
match: Hereditary Sensory and Autonomic Neuropathy Type III
search: Hereditary Sensory and Autonomic Neuropathy Type III
results.definition: A congenital disorder caused by mutations in the IKBKAP gene. It is characterized by damage of the sympathetic and parasympathetic and sensory nervous system.
synonyms: Hereditary Sensory and Autonomic Neuropathy Type III

results.name: Herpetic Gastritis
results.definition: Gastritis resulting from herpes virus.

results.name: Inflammatory Breast Carcinoma
results.definition: An advanced, invasive breast adenocarcinoma characterized by the presence of distinct changes in the overlying skin. These changes include diffuse erythema, edema, peau d'orange (skin of an orange) appearance, tenderness, induration, warmth, enlargement, and in some cases a palpable mass. The skin changes are the consequence of lymphatic obstruction from the underlying invasive breast adenocarcinoma. Microscopically, the dermal lymphatics show prominent infiltration by malignant cells. The invasive breast adenocarcinoma is usually of ductal, NOS type. There is not significant inflammatory cell infiltrate present, despite the name of this carcinoma.
results.glossary_definition: A type of breast cancer in which the breast looks red and swollen and feels warm. The skin of the breast may also show the pitted appearance called peau d'orange (like the skin of an orange). The redness and warmth occur because the cancer cells block the lymph vessels in the skin.

results.name: Cortical Blindness
results.definition: Visual impairment due to visual cortex dysfunction.
results.glossary_definition: Visual impairment due to visual cortex dysfunction.

results.name: Purine-Nucleoside Phosphorylase Deficiency
results.definition: PNP reversibly catalyzes the phosphorolysis of the purine nucleosides, (deoxy)inosine and (deoxy)guanosine, to their respective purine bases and the corresponding ribose-1-phosphate. Deficiency in this enzyme is an autosomal recessive cause of combined immunodeficiency.
parents: Combined T Cell And B Cell Immunodeficiency
ancestors: Combined T Cell And B Cell Immunodeficiency

results.name: Vulvar Proximal-Type Epithelioid Sarcoma
results.definition: An epithelioid sarcoma of the proximal type involving the vulva.

results.name: Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder
results.definition: A disorder characterized by a marked pattern of inattention and/or hyperactivity-impulsivity that is inconsistent with developmental level and clearly interferes with functioning in at least two settings (e.g. at home and at school). At least some of the symptoms must be present before the age of 7 years.
results.glossary_definition: A neurodevelopmental disorder presenting in early childhood that is characterized by chronic and excessive inattention, overactivity, and/or impulsivity.

results.name: Extraskeletal Ewing Sarcoma/Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor
results.name_text: Extraskeletal Ewing Sarcoma/Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor
match: Extraskeletal Ewing Sarcoma/Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor
Extraosseous Ewing Sarcoma/Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor
Extraosseous Ewing's Sarcoma/Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor
Extraskeletal Ewing Sarcoma/Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor
search: Extraskeletal Ewing Sarcoma/Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor
Extraosseous Ewing Sarcoma/Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor
Extraosseous Ewing's Sarcoma/Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor
Extraskeletal Ewing Sarcoma/Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor
results.definition: A spectrum of malignant tumors arising from the soft tissues, characterized morphologically by the presence of small round cells. Ewing sarcoma and peripheral primitive neuroectodermal tumor represent the ends of a spectrum, with Ewing sarcoma lacking evidence of neural differentiation and the markers that characterize the peripheral primitive neuroectodermal tumor. Ewing sarcoma and peripheral primitive neuroectodermal tumor may share cytogenetic abnormalities, proto-oncogene expression, cell culture and immunohistochemical abnormalities. Pain and the presence of a mass are the most common clinical symptoms.
synonyms: Extraosseous Ewing Sarcoma/Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor
Extraosseous Ewing's Sarcoma/Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor
Extraskeletal Ewing Sarcoma/Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor
children: Peripheral Primitive Neuroectodermal Tumor of Soft Tissues

results.name: Kidney Fibrosarcoma
results.definition: A usually aggressive malignant neoplasm arising from the kidney. It is characterized by the presence of spindle-shaped fibroblasts and collagenous stroma formation in a herringbone growth pattern.

results.name: Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Clear Cell Variant
results.name_text: Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Clear Cell Variant
match: Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Clear Cell Variant
Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Clear Cell Variant
search: Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Clear Cell Variant
Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Clear Cell Variant
results.definition: An invasive transitional cell carcinoma of the bladder characterized by the presence of clear cells.
synonyms: Infiltrating Bladder Urothelial Carcinoma, Clear Cell Variant

results.name: Transitional Cell Papilloma
results.definition: A benign papillary neoplasm composed of transitional cells which show preservation of the nuclear polarity.
results.glossary_definition: A benign papillary neoplasm composed of transitional cells.

results.name: Soft Tissue Neoplasm
results.definition: A benign, intermediate, or malignant neoplasm that arises from the soft tissue. The most common types are lipomatous (fatty), vascular, smooth muscle, fibrous, and fibrohistiocytic neoplasms.
results.glossary_definition: Neoplasms of whatever cell type or origin, occurring in the extraskeletal connective tissue framework of the body including the organs of locomotion and their various component structures, such as nerves, blood vessels, lymphatics, etc.
children: Benign Soft Tissue Tumor of Uncertain Differentiation
Central Nervous System Mesenchymal Non-meningothelial Tumor

results.name: Myopathy
results.definition: A non-neoplastic disorder that affects the muscles. Representative examples include muscular dystrophy, metabolic myopathies, muscular atrophies, and dermatomyositis.

results.name: Neurofibroma
results.definition: An intraneural or extraneural neoplasm arising from nerve tissues and neural sheaths. It is composed of perineurial-like fibroblasts and Schwann cells. It usually presents as a localized cutaneous lesion and less often as a circumscribed peripheral nerve mass. Patients with neurofibromatosis type 1 present with multiple masses. Neurofibromas which arise from major nerves and plexiform neurofibromas are precursor lesions to malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumors.
results.glossary_definition: A benign tumor that develops from the cells and tissues that cover nerves.
ancestors: Neuroepithelial, Perineurial, and Schwann Cell Neoplasm

results.name: Rectal Prolapse
results.definition: Protrusion of the rectum through the anus.
results.glossary_definition: Protrusion of the rectal mucous membrane through the anus. There are various degrees: incomplete with no displacement of the anal sphincter muscle; complete with displacement of the anal sphincter muscle; complete with no displacement of the anal sphincter muscle but with herniation of the bowel; and internal complete with rectosigmoid or upper rectum intussusception into the lower rectum.

results.name: Neurofibromatosis Type 1
results.definition: The most common type of neurofibromatosis. It is characterized clinically by cutaneous and subcutaneous tumors with patches of hyperpigmentation. The hyperpigmented skin areas, are present from birth and found anywhere on the body surface. They can vary markedly in size and color. The dark brown areas are called cafe-au-lait spots. The multiple cutaneous and subcutaneous tumors are nerve sheath tumors, called neurofibromas. They can develop anywhere along the peripheral nerve fibers. Neurofibromas can become quite large, causing a major disfigurement, eroding bone, and compressing various peripheral nerve structures. Type 1 neurofibromatosis has dominant inheritance, with a gene locus on the proximal long arm of chromosome 17.
results.glossary_definition: A rare genetic condition that causes brown spots and tumors on the skin, freckling in skin areas not exposed to the sun, tumors on the nerves, and developmental changes in the nervous system, muscles, bone, and skin.

results.name: Cervical Small Cell Carcinoma
match: Small Cell Carcinoma of the Cervix
Small Cell Carcinoma of Cervix Uteri
Small Cell Carcinoma of Uterine Cervix
Small Cell Carcinoma of the Cervix Uteri
Small Cell Carcinoma of the Cervix
Small Cell Carcinoma of the Uterine Cervix
search: Small Cell Carcinoma of the Cervix
Small Cell Carcinoma of Cervix Uteri
Small Cell Carcinoma of Uterine Cervix
Small Cell Carcinoma of the Cervix Uteri
Small Cell Carcinoma of the Cervix
Small Cell Carcinoma of the Uterine Cervix
results.oncotree_disease: Small Cell Carcinoma of the Cervix
results.definition: A small cell carcinoma arising from the cervix.
synonyms: Small Cell Carcinoma of Cervix Uteri
Small Cell Carcinoma of Uterine Cervix
Small Cell Carcinoma of the Cervix Uteri
Small Cell Carcinoma of the Cervix
Small Cell Carcinoma of the Uterine Cervix
